optume: <entryFree id="n32853" type="main" key="optu^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">optŭmē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">optĭm-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. bonus <sense id="n32853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="OPUS" /></sense></entryFree>
optumus: <entryFree id="n32854" type="main" key="optu^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">optŭmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">optĭm-</orth>), v. bonus.</entryFree>
optutu: <entryFree id="n32855" type="gloss" key="optu_tu_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">optūtū</orth>, <itype>quasi optuitu, a verbo</itype>, quod est tuor; <sense id="n32855.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">et significat video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=186" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 186</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
opulens: <entryFree id="n32856" type="main" key="o^pu^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpŭlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. opulentus.</entryFree>
opulentia: <entryFree id="n32857" type="main" key="o^pu^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpŭlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>opulens</etym>, <sense id="n32857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">riches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wealth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opulence</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n32857.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">habemus publice egestatem, privatim opulentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opulentia neglegentiam tolerabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 52</bibl></cit>. 9: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojae opulentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metallorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 93, 95, § 207</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos decent opulentiae et factiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiis atque opulentiis anteire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:5:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32857.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like opes, <hi rend="ital">resources</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, of a people: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia ex opulentiā orta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lydorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32857.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">richness</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 21</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
opulentitas: <entryFree id="n32858" type="main" key="o^pu^lenti^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpŭlentĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wealth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi> (ante class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quasi ejus opulentitatem reverearis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: nostra, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 146, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opulento: <entryFree id="n32859" type="main" key="o^pu^lento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpŭlento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enrich</hi> (poet and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">erum bacis olivae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensam pretiosis dapibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opulentus: <entryFree id="n32860" type="main" key="o^pu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (less freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpŭlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 69:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 69, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 248, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 2, 7</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ops, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=92" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 92</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n32860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wealthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opulent</hi> (syn.: dives, locuples; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. inops,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 20, 70</bibl>; class.). </sense><sense id="n32860.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: opulenti, terrestribus rebus copiosi, Fest. s. v opis, p. 187 Müll. </sense><sense id="n32860.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: magnae gentes opulentae, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=301" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 301</bibl> Müll.; so, oppidum, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 470, 4</bibl> (Trag. v. 324 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opulentissima civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 81</bibl></cit>: opulentae matronae, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6</bibl> (Trag. v. 294 Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">for which: opulens matrona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 248, 11</bibl></cit>.— .</sense><sense id="n32860.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">opulentus auro adulescens,</quote> <trans><tr>rich in gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars Numidiae agro virisque opulentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 16, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gens opulentissima viris armisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus victor opulentusque praedā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 34, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum donis opulentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 447</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32860.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi> in any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">copia Ruris honorum opulenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia pecuniae opulenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n32860.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32860.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opulentum opsonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opulentissima dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:54" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opulentissimus liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: opulenta requies, Vulg Isa. 32, 18.—</sense><sense id="n32860.7" n="B" level="2"> Of respectability or rank, <hi rend="ital">respectable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>: opulenti pariter atque ignobiles, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 4, 3</bibl> (Trag. v. 230 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 53, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opulentior factio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 32</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpŭlentē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpŭlenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">richly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendidly</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): neque illos arte colam, me opulenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opulente ornata domus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 333, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos opulentius instructiusque facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35, 7</bibl></cit>: epulari, Inst, 3, 3, 5.</sense></entryFree>
opulesco: <entryFree id="n32861" type="hapax" key="o^pu^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpŭlesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n32861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [ops], <hi rend="ital">to grow rich</hi>: in patriis opulescere campis, Furius poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 11, 4</bibl> (also ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 148, 17</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
opulus: <entryFree id="n32862" type="main" key="o^pu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of maple-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arboribus, quas vocant opulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:7:1 al" default="NO">5, 7, 1 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opunculo: <entryFree id="n32863" type="gloss" key="o^puncu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpuncŭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>opilio</etym>, <sense id="n32863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bird that imitates the shepherd's song</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=191" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 191</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
opuntius: <entryFree id="n32864" type="main" key="O^punti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpuntĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 3. Opus, II.</entryFree>
opus: <entryFree id="n32865" type="main" key="o^pus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. ap-as, work; whence apuas, gain; v. ops; cf. also Germ. üben</etym>. <sense id="n32865.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32865.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">labor</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">labor, ars, opera): quod in opere faciundo operae consumis tuae,</quote> <trans><tr>in doing your work</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">menses octo continuos opus hic non defuit, cum vas nullum fieret, nisi aureum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio in causarum contentionibus magnum est quoddam opus, atque haud sciam, an de humanisoperibus longe maximum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32865.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n32865.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">art</hi>, <hi rend="ital">workmanship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturā et opere munitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32865.4" n="2" level="3"> Of agricultural labor: <cit><quote lang="la">opus faciam, ut defatiger usque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grave Martis opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 515</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32865.5" n="3" level="3"> Of honey-making: foris <pb n="1274" /> <cb n="OPUS" /> pascuntur (apes), intus opus faciunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32865.6" n="4" level="3"> Of literary labor: <cit><quote lang="la">(Graeci) opus quaerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>seek employment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:34:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 34, 81</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32865.7" n="5" level="3"> In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32865.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a work</hi> that has been done or made. </sense><sense id="n32865.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A military work</hi>, either <hi rend="ital">a defensive work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortification</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">a work of besiegers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a siege-engine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">machine</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum opere castrorum perfecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">opere perfecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mutinam operibus munitionibusque saepsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operibus Toletum cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32865.10" n="B" level="2"> Any result of labor. </sense><sense id="n32865.11" n="1" level="3"> Of public works, esp. buildings: <cit><quote lang="la">aedium sacrarum, publicorumque operum depopulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:1" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 57, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de exstruendis reficiendisve operibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera, templum theatrumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of an aqueduct, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in titulis operum,</quote> <trans><tr>in public inscriptions</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 41</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n32865.12" n="2" level="3"> Of writings, <hi rend="ital">a work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">book</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habeo opus magnum in manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an pangis aliquid Sophocleum? Fac opus appareat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Homerus atque Vergilius operum suorum principiis faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:64" default="NO">3, 6, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:83" default="NO">10, 1, 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32865.13" n="3" level="3"> Of a work of art: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum iste non opere delectabatur, sed pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:56:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 56, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hydria Boëthi manu facta praeclaro opere,</quote> <trans><tr>of admirable workmanship</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">32: haec omnia antiquo opere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>, § 46.—</sense><sense id="n32865.14" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a deed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">performance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">business</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserum'st opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si mures corroserint aliquid, quorum est opus hoc unum, monstrum putemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 27, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus meae hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 112</bibl></cit>.—For magno opere, tanto opere, quanto opere (and, joined in one word, magnopere, tantopere, quantopere), lit., <hi rend="ital">with great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">what labor</hi>, v. h. vv.—</sense><sense id="n32865.15" n="D" level="2"> Esp. (eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n32865.16" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A work of superhuman power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a miracle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Joh. 5, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32865.17" n="2" level="3"> Bona opera, = <foreign lang="greek">kala\ e)/rga</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">good works</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deeds wrought by grace</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 18, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 5, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32865.18" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">abstr.</hi> in <case>nom.</case> and <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">need</hi>, <hi rend="ital">necessity;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n32865.19" n="A" level="2"> Opus est, <hi rend="ital">it is needful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wanting; there is need of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use for</hi>: opus est mihi, tibi, etc., <hi rend="ital">I</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thou</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">have need of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">need</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want.</hi> It is contrasted with necesse est: emas non quod opus est, sed quod necesse est. Quod non opus est, asse carum est, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 28</bibl>. Also with indigere: <cit><quote lang="la">ait (Chrysippus) sapien. tem nullā re indigere, et tamen multis illi rebus opus esse, contra stulto nullā re opus est, nullā re enim uti scit, sed omnibus eget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 12</bibl></cit>. The person who needs any thing is put in the <case>dat.</case>, and the thing needed in the <case>nom.</case> or <case>abl.</case> (prop. <hi rend="ital">abl. instrum.</hi>: opus est mihi, <hi rend="ital">I have work</hi> with, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I need</hi>), rarely in the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">ut.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32865.20" n="(a)" level="5"> With the <case>nom.</case> of the thing needed as subject: <cit><quote lang="la">materiem, et quae opus sunt, dominus praebebit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus multi opus sunt boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritumi milites opus sunt tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux nobis et auctor opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus nobis exempla permulta opus sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:19:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 19, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ullā in re, quod ad valetudinem opus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid opus erit in sumptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parari, quae ad transitum Hellesponti opus essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae curando vulneri opus sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 41, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferociora utraque quam quietis opus est consiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 30, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. with esse: nil sibi divitias opus esse, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32865.21" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratibus opus est,</quote> <trans><tr>there is need of</tr>, <tr>they are needed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viro et gubernatore opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus est auctoritate tuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non longis opus est ambagibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc opus est leviore lyrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 152</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">pers. subj.</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">responderunt regem discordiis opus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.— So with <hi rend="ital">abl. of the part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturato opus est,</quote> <trans><tr>there is need of haste</tr>, <tr>it is necessary to act speedily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">erat nihil cur properato opus esset,</quote> <trans><tr>of haste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:19:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 19, 49</bibl></cit> (cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 464, A, 1).— With <hi rend="ital">abl. of the sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita dictu opus est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is necessary to say</tr>, <tr>I must say</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod scitu opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:20:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 20, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32865.22" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad consilium pensandum temporis opus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanti argenti opus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32865.23" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">puero opus est cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 71</bibl>: opus est modium unum <cb n="ORA" /> (calcis), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 15</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid opus est de Dionysio tam valde affirmare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid opus est plura? (sc. proferre),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc opus est te animo valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus nutrici autem, utrem ut habeat veteris vini largiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 31 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 30</bibl>.— (<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">non est opus affingas aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 33, 11</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 279</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32865.24" n="2" level="3"> Sometimes opus est is employed without the notion of strict necessity, as i. q. expedit, juvat, conducit, <hi rend="ital">it is good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneficial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque haud sciam, an ne opus sit quidem, nihil umquam omnino deesse amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 11, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 32, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 116</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32865.25" n="B" level="2"> Opus habere, <hi rend="ital">to have need of</hi> (very rare); with <case>abl.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 5</bibl>: opus habere ut, Ambros. de Fide, 5, 17, 213; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non dicimus opus habeo, sed opus est mihi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 301</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32866" type="main" key="O^pu_s2" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpūs</orth>, <itype>ūntis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)opou=s</foreign>, <sense id="n32866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Locris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Greece</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kardhenitza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 73</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32866.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpūn-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Opuntian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philodamus,</quote> <trans><tr>of Opus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:44:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 44, § 109</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpūntĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Opus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Opuntians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
opusculum: <entryFree id="n32867" type="main" key="o^puscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpuscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. opus</etym>, <sense id="n32867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little work</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Myrmecides minutorum opusculorum fabricator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipies igitur hoc parvum opusculum lucubratum his jam contractioribus noctibus, id. Par. prooem. § 5: Cassi Parmensis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ora: <entryFree id="n32868" type="main" key="o_ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindred with Sanscr. avāra, ripa citerior fluminis</etym>, <sense id="n32868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the extremity</hi> of a thing; <hi rend="ital">the border</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">edge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">margin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boundary.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32868.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32868.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.; syn.: limbus, fimbria, instita, margo): omnes avidi spectant ad carceris oras, <hi rend="ital">at the barriers</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 88 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">oras pocula circum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(clipei),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=182" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 182</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 26, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hag. 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether, extrema ora et determinatio mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 101</bibl></cit>. cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">regio nes, quarum nulla esset ora, nulla extremitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32868.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the coast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea-coast</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">litus, ripa): Graeciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jordanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 9, 43</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but transf.: ora maritima,</quote> <trans><tr>the inhabitants of the coast</tr>, <tr>people of the maritime districts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:23:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 23, 67</bibl></cit>. So, jam Misenensem classem et pulcherrimam Campaniam oram descivisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32868.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32868.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A region</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">country</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quacumque in orā ac parte terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66:164" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 66, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelida, Hor C. 1, 26, 4: conexa arbustorum ratio est, quas in oras debeant spectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:2:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit> (al. horas): <cit><quote lang="la">Trojae qui primus ab oris Italiam ... venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 97</bibl>; 10, 706.—</sense><sense id="n32868.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: luminis orae, <hi rend="ital">the world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">light</hi>: tu produxisti nos intra luminis oras, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:41:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 41, 64</bibl> (Ann. v. 118 Vahl.); cf.: sum (i. e. eum) quae dederit in luminis oras, id. Fragm. ap. Fest. s. v. sum, p. 298 Müll. (Ann. v. 165 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde enascitur atque oras in luminis exit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 170</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:179" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 179</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:781" default="NO" valid="yes">781</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem Rhea sacerdos Furtivum partu sub luminis edidit oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 660</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponte suā quae se tollunt in luminis oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: Acherontis orae, <hi rend="ital">the lower regions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animas Acheruntis in oras Ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 763</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32868.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A zone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">globum terrae duabus oris distantibus habitabilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 68</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32868.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A rope</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cable</hi> by which a ship or boat is fastened to the shore; opp. ancoralia, <hi rend="ital">the anchor-cables</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alii resolutis oris in ancoras evecti tenentur, alii, ne quid teneat, ancoralia incidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 19, 10</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne hostes cum suis simul inrumperent, trahunt scalas orasque et ancoras praecidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:36:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 36, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sublatae sunt ancorae, solvimus oram, profecti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; Ep. ad Tryph. 3.—</sense><sense id="n32868.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (very rare, and only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): quis potis ingentes oras evolvere belli? qs. <hi rend="ital">to unroll the edges of the picture of this war</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 178 Vahl.): <cb n="ORAT" /> imitated by Virgil: <cit><quote lang="la">aspirate canenti ... Et mecum ingentis oras evolvite belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 528</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Serv. ad loc.: in luminis oras eruere,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring to light</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1455</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32869" type="main" key="O^ra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Hŏra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of Hersilia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a goddess</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:851" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 851</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orabilis: <entryFree id="n32870" type="gloss" key="o_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>oro</etym>, <sense id="n32870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exorable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oracularius: <entryFree id="n32871" type="main" key="o_ra_cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrācŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>oraculum</etym>, <sense id="n32871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dealing in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">uttering oracles; prophetic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habuit autem oracularios servos, qui illum pessum dederunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:43" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oraculum: <entryFree id="n32872" type="main" key="o_ra_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrācŭlum</orth> (sync. oraclum: ex oraclo, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:21:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 21, 42</bibl>, or Trag. v. 65 Vahl.; <sense id="n32872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plur</hi>, oracla, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 488, 2</bibl>, or Trag. Rel. p. 185 Rib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 321</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>oro</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a divine announcement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an oracle</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n32872.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oracula ex eo ipso appellata sunt, quod inest in his deorum oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:20:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 20, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est enim oraculum? nempe voluntas divina hominis ore enuntiata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere a Dodonā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 43, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 456</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delphis oracula cessant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:555" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 555</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32872.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32872.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a prophetic declaration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prophecy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exposui somnii et furoris oracula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 32, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 50, 115</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32872.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A place where oracular responses were given</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an oracle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud oraculum Delphis tam celebre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:19:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 19, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hammonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 23, 49, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delphicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32872.5" n="2" level="3"> Esp. (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">the mercy-seat</hi>, the place in the tabernacle in which the presence of God was manifest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">40, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oraculum templi, sanctum sanctorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3 Reg. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32872.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An oracular saying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oracle</hi> pronounced by a man: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ego nunc physicorum oracula fundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:24:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 24, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde illa reliqua oracula: nequam agricolam esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 40</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32872.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An imperial rescript</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:11:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 11, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orarium: <entryFree id="n32873" type="main" key="o_ra_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. ōs</etym>, <sense id="n32873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a napkin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handkerchief</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 539, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculum ligavit orario, Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 8, 7.—Used in signifying applause,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
orarius: <entryFree id="n32874" type="main" key="o_ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. ora</etym>, <sense id="n32874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the coast</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <trans><tr>coasting-vessels</tr>, <tr>coasters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 15</bibl></cit> (26); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">naviculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 10:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 28, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orata: <entryFree id="n32875" type="main" key="O_ra_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōrāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appellation bestowed on a certain Sergius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of his fondness for the gilt bream</hi> (aurata, orata, v. auro, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 10</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=182" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 182</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
oratim: <entryFree id="n32876" type="hapax" key="o_ra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>1. ora</etym>, <sense id="n32876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coastwise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from coast to coast</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 3</bibl> dub. (al. moratim).</sense></entryFree>
oratio: <entryFree id="n32877" type="main" key="o_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>oro</etym>, <sense id="n32877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">language</hi> </sense><sense id="n32877.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the connection of words to express thought</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est autem in verbo modus hic, sed in oratione, id est, in continuatione verborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> 3, 42, 167</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n32877.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the power</hi> or <hi rend="ital">faculty of speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the habit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">use of language</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (ferae) sunt rationis et orationis expertes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura vi rationis hominem conciliat homini et ad orationis et ad vitae societatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32877.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utterance;</hi> opp. to fact, action, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">lenitudo orationis, mollitudo corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:16:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idque videns Epicurus re tollit, oratione relinquit deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sunt leves locutores ... eorum orationem bene existimatum est in ore nasci, non in pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quid te igitur rettulit beneficum esse oratione, si ad rem auxilium emortuum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in vitā, sic in oratione, nihil est difficilius quam quid deceat videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:21:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 21, 70</bibl></cit>: qualis homo ipse esset, talem ejus esse orationem; <cit><quote lang="la">orationi autem facta similia, factis vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:16:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes igitur orationis secundum dialecticos duae, nomen et verbum,</quote> <trans><tr>parts of speech</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32877.4" n="3" level="3"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">a mode of speaking; a kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">style of speech; language</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu istanc orationem hinc veterem atque antiquam amoves. Nam proletario sermone nunc utere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 155</bibl></cit>: nam opulenti cum loquuntur pariter atque ignobiles, eadem dicta eademque oratio aequa non aeque valet, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 4, 3</bibl>: quam tibi ex ore orationem duriter dictis dedit, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 512, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliam nunc mihi orationem despoliato praedicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: Creta est profecto horum hominum oratio, quam orationem<pb n="1275" /> <cb n="ORAT" />  hanc aures dulce devorant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Andria et Perinthia) non ita sunt dissimili argumento, sed tamen Dissimili oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 11</bibl></cit>.—Esp. (in gram.): oratio obliqua, <hi rend="ital">indirect speech</hi>, the use of dependent clauses in citing the language of others: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (orationem) obliquam Pompeius Trogus exposuit (opp. to conciones directae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:3:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32877.5" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Mode of speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use of language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">style</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis est enim oratio philosophorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 19, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fabulae) tenui oratione et scripturā levi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Stoicorum est astrictior oratio aliquantoque contractior, quam aures populi requirunt, sic illorum (Peripateticorum) liberior et latior, quam patitur consuetudo judiciorum et fori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 31, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem Latinam efficies profecto legendis nostris pleniorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32877.6" n="5" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the language</hi> of any people or nation: <cit><quote lang="la">Timaeus in historiis quas oratione Graecā composuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper cum Graecis Latina (exempla) conjunxi ... ut par sis in utriusque orationis facultate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32877.7" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">formal language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artificial discourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set speech</hi> (opp. to sermo, <hi rend="ital">ordinary speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conversational language</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">mollis est oratio philosophorum et umbratilis, nec verbis instructa popularibus nec vincta numeris, sed soluta liberius: itaque sermo potiusquam oratio dicitur. Quamquam enim omnis locutio oratio est, tamen unius oratoris locutio hoc proprio dignata nomine est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 19, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et quoniam magna vis orationis est eaque duplex, altera contentionis, altera sermonis, contentio disceptationibus tribuatur judiciorum, contionum, senatus, sermo in circulis, disputationibus, congressionibus familiarium versetur, sequatur etiam convivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 37, 132</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32877.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A set speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harangue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oratio) ut gravis, ut suavis, ut erudita sit, ut liberalis, ut polita, ut sensus, ut doloris habeat quantum opus sit, non est singulorum articulorum: in toto spectantur haec corpore, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 96</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the context: illam orationem disertam sibi et oratoriam videri, fortem et virilem non videri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 54, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc habere orationem mecum principio institit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraeque scribuntur orationes habitae jam, non ut habeantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:24:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 24, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est haec oratio habenda apud imperitam multitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 29, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignarus faciundae ac poliendae orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:14:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 14, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in orationibus hisce ipsis judiciorum, contionum, senatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta illa, di immortales, fuit gravitas, quanta in oratione majestas! sed adfuistis, et est in manibus oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui orationem adversus rem publicam habuissent, eorum bona in publicum adducebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab adulescentiā confecit orationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cat. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catonis aliae acerbae orationes extant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 42, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio plebi acceptior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accurata et polita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:326" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 95, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acris et vehemens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admirabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angusta et concisa, opp. collata et diffusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:187" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 56, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera, tristis, horrida, neque perfecta neque conclusa, opp. laevis et structa et terminata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumcisa et brevis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotunda et undique circumcisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohaerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concinna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 25, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabilis, opp. volubilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:187" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 56, 187</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32877.9" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32877.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The power of oratory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eloquence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam vim habet illa, quae recte a bono poëtā dicta est, flexamina atque omnium regina rerum oratio, ut non modo inclinantem excipere aut stantem inclinare, sed etiam adversantem ac repugnantem ut imperator fortis ac bonus capere possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis in eo fuisse orationis atque ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:45:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 45, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim verendum est ne te in tam bonā causā deficiat oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32877.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Prose</hi> (opp. to poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">et in poëmatis et in oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:21:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 21, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32877.12" n="C" level="2"> (In gram.) <hi rend="ital">A sentence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a clause expressing a complete sense</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio est ordinatio dictionum congrua sententiam perfectam demonstrans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio dicitur liber rhetoricus, necnon unaquaeque dictio hoc saepe nomine nuncupatur cum plenam ostendit sententiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: defectio litterae, et syllabae, et dictionis,<cb n="ORAT" />  et orationis, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 1, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32877.13" n="D" level="2"> (Under the empire.) <hi rend="ital">An imperial message</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rescript</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes ad senatum missae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio principis per quaestorem ejus audita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationesque in senatu recitaret etiam quaestoris vice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32877.14" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A prayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an address to the Deity</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">respice ad orationem servi tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per orationes Dominum rogantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Macc. 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernoctans in oratione Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 6, 12</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the habit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">practice of prayer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perseverantes in oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationi instate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Col. 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oratiuncula: <entryFree id="n32878" type="main" key="o_ra_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>oratio</etym>, <sense id="n32878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a brief oration</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 19, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aureola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oratius: <entryFree id="n32879" type="main" key="O^ra_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrātĭus</orth>, arch. for Horatius, v. Vahl. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:v. 164, p. 27" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. v. 164, p. 27</bibl>.</entryFree>
orator: <entryFree id="n32880" type="main" key="o_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>oro, one who speaks</etym>. <sense id="n32880.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A speaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orator</hi> (very common in all periods and styles of writing): <cit><quote lang="la">eum (oratorem) puto esse, qui et verbis ad audiendum jucundis et sententiis ad probandum accommodatis uti possit in causis forensibus atque communibus. Hunc ego appello oratorem, eumque esse praeterea instructum voce et actione et lepore quodam volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is orator erit, meā sententiā, hoc tam gravi dignus nomine, qui, quaecunque res inciderit, quae sit dictione explicanda, prudenter et composite et ornate et memoriter dicet cum quādam actionis etiam dignitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19, 61</bibl>: spernitur orator bonus, horridus miles amatur, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10</bibl> (Ann. v. 273 Vahl.): additur orator Cornelius suaviloquenti Ore, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 15, 58</bibl> (Ann. v. 304 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">oratorem celeriter complexi sumus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>eloquence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32880.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n32880.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The orator</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Cicero</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32880.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Title of a treatise by Cicero</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32880.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A speaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spokesman</hi> of an errand or embassy: <cit><quote lang="la">aequom'st eram oratores mittere ad me, donaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 145</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">an ambassador</hi> charged with an oral message: orator sine pace redit regique refert rem, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=41" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 41</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 211 Vahl.): Aetolos pacem velle de eā re oratores Romam profectos, Cato ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=182" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 182</bibl> Müll.: oratores populi, summi viri; <cit><quote lang="la">Ambraciā veniunt huc legati puplice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veientes pacem petitum oratores Romam mittunt, Liv 1, 15: foederum, pacis, belli, induciarum oratores fetiales judicesve sunto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittor et Iliacas audax orator ad arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum oratores augusta ad moenia regis Ire jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32880.5" n="III" level="1"> One who prays or supplicates for any thing, <hi rend="ital">an entreater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beseecher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppliant</hi> (Plautin.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 145</bibl>; so in the twofold signif. of <hi rend="ital">ambassador</hi> and <hi rend="ital">beseecher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oratorie: <entryFree id="n32881" type="main" key="o_ra_to_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrātōrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. oratorius <sense id="n32881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
oratorius: <entryFree id="n32882" type="main" key="o_ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>orator</etym>. <sense id="n32882.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an orator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oratorical</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 231</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:261" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 75, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars, Quint. praef. § 17: gestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 3, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:29:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 29, 110</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32882.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrātōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. ars), <hi rend="ital">the oratorical art</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oratory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2" default="NO">2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n32882.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to praying;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrātōrĭum</orth>, ii. <gen>n.</gen> (sc. templum), <hi rend="ital">a place of prayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an oratory</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in oratorio nemo aliquid agat, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 109" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judith ingressa est oratorium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrā-tōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">oratorically</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pulchre, et oratorie dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:68:227" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 68, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 56, 69</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. to tragice, comice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 100:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 100, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oratrix: <entryFree id="n32883" type="main" key="o_ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n32883.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">She that prays</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beseeches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a female suppliant</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">me oratricem haud sprevisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 80</bibl></cit>: pacis et foederis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:8:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 8, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32883.1" n="II" level="1"> A transl. of <foreign lang="greek">r(htorikh/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">rhetoric</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oratory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 14, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oratum: <entryFree id="n32884" type="main" key="o_ra_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>oro</etym>, <sense id="n32884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreaty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplication</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum orata ejus reminiscor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oratus: <entryFree id="n32885" type="main" key="o_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (only in <sense id="n32885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> and <number>plur.</number>), <cb n="ORBI" /> <gen>m.</gen> <etym>oro</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a praying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreating; a request</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreaty</hi> (very rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">oratu tuo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 37, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illarum oratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 14 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>: magnis oratibus, Coripp. Laud. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orbatio: <entryFree id="n32886" type="main" key="orba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>orbo</etym>, <sense id="n32886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a depriving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privation</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orbator: <entryFree id="n32887" type="main" key="orba_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who deprives others of children</hi> or <hi rend="ital">parents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bereaver</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nostri orbator, Achilles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 500</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orbefacio: <entryFree id="n32888" type="gloss" key="orbe^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>orbus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n32888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bereave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make an orphan</hi>: orbefacio, <foreign lang="greek">o)rfani/zw</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
orbelus: <entryFree id="n32889" type="main" key="Orbe_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orbēlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-lŏs</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)orbhlo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain on the borders of Macedonia and Thrace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orbelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orbicularis: <entryFree id="n32890" type="main" key="orbi^cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbĭcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>orbiculus</etym>, <sense id="n32890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">circular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orbicular</hi>, an appellation of a plant: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orbiculatim: <entryFree id="n32891" type="main" key="orbi^cu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbĭcŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">circularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in circles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rings</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 67, § 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orbiculatus: <entryFree id="n32892" type="main" key="orbi^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">circleshaped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orbiculate</hi> (class.): mala, <hi rend="ital">round apples</hi>, an excellent kind of apple, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:45:5" default="NO">12, 45, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 19, 2</bibl>.— Hence, transf.: malis orbiculatis pasti, i. e. <hi rend="ital">well-fed</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capita caulium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 109, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitus foliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 15, 87, § 137</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orbiculor: <entryFree id="n32893" type="gloss" key="orbi^cu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbĭcŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go round in a circle</hi>: orbiculatur, <foreign lang="greek">kukleu/ei</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
orbiculus: <entryFree id="n32894" type="main" key="orbi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>orbis</etym>, <sense id="n32894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small disk; a sheave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pulley</hi>, etc. (anteclass. and post-Aug.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R.
