R. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 30, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 5</bibl>: radix concisa in orbiculos, <hi rend="ital">cut in little disks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slices</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 94, § 148</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2519</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp.,</quote> <trans><tr>the nave of a wheel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orbicus: <entryFree id="n32895" type="main" key="orbi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. orbitus.</entryFree>
orbifico: <entryFree id="n32896" type="hapax" key="orbi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>orbus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n32896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bereave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make childless</hi>: orbificor liberorum leto, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 179, 26</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 161 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
orbile: <entryFree id="n32897" type="spur" key="orbi_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbīle</orth>, a false read. for orbis ... ligneus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 15</bibl>.</entryFree>
orbilius: <entryFree id="n32898" type="main" key="Orbi^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orbĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So, Orbilius, <hi rend="ital">a grammarian in Rome in the time of Cicero</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orbis: <entryFree id="n32899" type="main" key="orbis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>nom.</case> orbs, Ven. Carm. 8, 5. —<sense id="n32899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Abl. regul.</hi> orbe; <cit><quote lang="la">but orbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex orbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; Rutil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 112</bibl> P.: orbi terrae, in the meaning <hi rend="ital">in the world</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:30:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 30, 66</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">orbi terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:38:section=82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 38, § 82</bibl></cit> Halm; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 10, 24</bibl>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 112</bibl> P.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. akin to Sanscr. dhvar, bend, twist</etym>, any thing of a circular shape, <hi rend="ital">a ring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round surface</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hoop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orbit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a circle</hi> (class.; cf.: circus, circulus, gyrus, spira). </sense><sense id="n32899.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in orbem torquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curvare aliquid in orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certumque equitavit in orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:468" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 468</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a ring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et digitum justo commodus orbe teras,</quote> <trans><tr>fit exactly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unionum,</quote> <trans><tr>roundness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 113</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a circle</hi> formed by men: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in orbem consisterent,</quote> <trans><tr>place themselves in a circle</tr>, <tr>form a circle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illi, orbe facto, se defenderent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem volventes suos increpans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in orbem pugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 22, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in orbem sese stantibus equis defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:33:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 33, 15</bibl></cit>: stella (<foreign lang="greek">fae/qwn</foreign>) eundem duodecim signorum orbem annis duodecim conficit, <hi rend="ital">the zodiac</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacteus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Milky Way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:16:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 16, 16</bibl></cit>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">orbit</hi> of a heavenly body: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera circulos suos orbesque conficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 15, 15</bibl></cit>.—Of a serpent, the <hi rend="ital">windings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coils</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensis orbibus angues Incumbunt pelago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 204</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a circular surface</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis mensae,</quote> <trans><tr>a round table-top</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:122" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 122</bibl>.—Also, simply orbes, <hi rend="ital">a round table</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:43" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:137" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 137</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a quoit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">discus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus ab orbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:590" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 590</bibl></cit>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">scale</hi> of a balance: <cit><quote lang="la">instabilis natat alterno depressior orbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:44" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 44</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a mirror</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">addidit et nitidum sacratis crinibus orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:18:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 18, 5</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a shield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (hasta) per orbem Aere cavum triplici ... Transiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:783" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 783</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 89</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a mosaic pavement of rounded pieces</hi> <pb n="1276" /> <cb n="ORBI" /> <hi rend="ital">of marble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:175" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 175</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a scale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one side of a balance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:44" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 44</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the millstones</hi> of an oil-mill, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 22</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">wooden disk</hi> placed over olives in pressing them, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">hoop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tire</hi> of a wheel: <cit><quote lang="la">rotarum orbes circumacti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 19, § 52</bibl></cit>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">wheel</hi> itself: <cit><quote lang="la">undaque jam tergo ferratos sustinet orbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 361</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">the wheel of fortune</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:70" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:8:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 3, 56</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">socket</hi> of the eye: <cit><quote lang="la">inanem luminis orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 200</bibl></cit>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">eye</hi> itself: <cit><quote lang="la">gemino lumen ab orbe venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardentes oculorum orbes ad moenia torsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 670</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the sun's disk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">orb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucidus orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 459</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the moon's disk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">orb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quater junctis implevit cornibus orbem Luna, quater plenum tenuata retexuit orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 530</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the circle of the world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the universe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter arce suā totum cum spectet in orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:85" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renatus,</quote> <trans><tr>the new-born day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:56" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 56</bibl></cit>: terrarum or terrae, <hi rend="ital">the circle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">orb of the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the world</hi> (since the ancients regarded the earth as a circular plane or disk): <cit><quote lang="la">permittitur infinita potestas orbis terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager Campanus orbis terrae pulcherrimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:30:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 30, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctus ob Italiam terrarum clauditur orbis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 233</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 224</bibl>.—Also, simply orbis (so mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">hic, ubi nunc Roma est orbis caput, arbor et herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:93" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:168" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 168</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:148" default="NO">4, 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">universus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 12, 9</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">a country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">region</hi>, <hi rend="ital">territory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eoo dives ab orbe redit,</quote> <trans><tr>the East</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:466" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 466</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Assyrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:108" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 12, 26, § 45</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">A kind of fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 5, § 14</bibl> Sillig; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 6, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n32899.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a circle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32899.3" n="A" level="2"> Of things that return at a certain period of time, <hi rend="ital">a rotation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circuit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut idem in singulos annos orbis volveretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insigne regium in orbem per omnes iret,</quote> <trans><tr>in rotation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis hic in re publicā est conversus,</quote> <trans><tr>the circle of political changes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32899.4" n="B" level="2"> Orbis doctrinae, <hi rend="ital">an encyclopœdia</hi>: orbis ille doctrinae quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">e)gku/klion paidei/an</foreign> vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32899.5" n="C" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">a rounding off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roundness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rotundity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circuitum, et quasi orbem verborum conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:51:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 51, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:234" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 71, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia non tam finitos numeros quam orbem quendam contextumque desiderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:129" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32899.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A circle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cycle of thought</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae Pyrrhonis in hunc orbem quem circumscripsimus, incidere non possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 8, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">circa vilem patulumque orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32899.7" n="E" level="2"> Esp.: in orbem ire, <hi rend="ital">to go the rounds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque dierum spatio finiebatur imperium ac per omnes in orbem ibant,</quote> <trans><tr>in turn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 36, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orbita: <entryFree id="n32900" type="main" key="orbi^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>orbis</etym>. <sense id="n32900.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A track</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rut</hi> made in the ground by a wheel. </sense><sense id="n32900.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">impressa orbita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 3, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32900.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a track</hi>, <hi rend="ital">course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">path</hi> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): neque id ab orbitā matrum familias instituti, quod, etc., Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 542, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 58, 83, § 227</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a beaten path</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteris culpae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>bad example</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:37" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32900.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An impression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark</hi> left by a ligature: <cit><quote lang="la">vinculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 210</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32900.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A circuit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orbit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbita lunae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunaris illa orbita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:10:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orbitanium: <entryFree id="n32901" type="main" key="Orbi^ta_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orbĭtānĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n32901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Samnium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orbitas: <entryFree id="n32902" type="main" key="orbi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>orbus</etym>, <sense id="n32902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bereavement</hi> of parents or children, of a husband or other dear person, <hi rend="ital">childlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orphanage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">widowhood</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n32902.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in orbitatem liberos producere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum liberi, misera orbitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea, quod sine liberis sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutorem instituere (filiorum) orbitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum uxores cum viderent exsilio additam orbitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximā orbitate rei publicae virorum talium,</quote> <trans><tr>at a time when the state is greatly in want of such men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbitates liberūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 24, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 188</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32902.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a deprivation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">loss</hi> of a thing (post-Aug.): luminis (<hi rend="ital">of an eye</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 37, 37, § 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 3, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">blindness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> <cb n="ORCH" /></sense></entryFree>
orbitosus: <entryFree id="n32903" type="main" key="orbi^to_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbĭtōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>orbita</etym>, <sense id="n32903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of cart-ruts</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 8, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orbitudo: <entryFree id="n32904" type="main" key="orbi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>orbus</etym>, <sense id="n32904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bereavement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orphanhood</hi> (ante-class. for orbitas): miseret orbitudinis, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 146, 17</bibl>; Pac. and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0146,001:ib. 18 sq" default="NO"><author>Turp.</author> ib. 18 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
orbitus: <entryFree id="n32905" type="main" key="orbi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>orbis</etym>, <sense id="n32905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">circular</hi> (anteand post-class.): motu, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 148, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 83</bibl> (others read orbico; cf. Oehler ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Menipp. p. 139" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Menipp. p. 139</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
orbius: <entryFree id="n32906" type="main" key="Orbi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orbĭus clīvus</orth>, <sense id="n32906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in Rome</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=182" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 182</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">the same called Urbius clivus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. Becker's Antiq. 1, p. 526.</sense></entryFree>
orbo: <entryFree id="n32907" type="main" key="orbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>orbus</etym>, <sense id="n32907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bereave</hi> of parents, children, or other dear persons; <hi rend="ital">to make fatherless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">motherless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">childless</hi>, etc. (class.; syn.: privo, viduo). </sense><sense id="n32907.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">filio orbatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater orbata filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 15, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbatura patres fulmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 391</bibl></cit>.—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">catulo lactente orbata leaena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 547</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32907.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to deprive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bereave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strip</hi> of any (esp. a precious) thing: pater me lumine orbavit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 250</bibl> P. (Trag. v. 351 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam juventute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:24:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patria multis claris viris orbata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantā gloriā orbatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferum voce eruditā spoliatum atque orbatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbatae caligant vela carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:138" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 138</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orbona: <entryFree id="n32908" type="main" key="Orbo_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orbōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tutelary goddess of parents bereft of their children</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:25:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 25, 63</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 131</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orbus: <entryFree id="n32909" type="main" key="orbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>kindr. with Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)rfano/s</foreign>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=183" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 183</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n32909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bereaved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bereft</hi>, of parents or children; <hi rend="ital">parentless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatherless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">childless</hi> (class.; cf. pupillus). </sense><sense id="n32909.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">parens liberorum an orbus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:23" default="NO">7, 4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filii mei, te incolumi, orbi non erunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Memnonis orba mei venio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 595</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a totidem natis orba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 156</bibl></cit>.—Of beasts: <cit><quote lang="la">liberis orbae oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 38</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">orba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an orphan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut orbae, qui sunt genere proximi, iis nubant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 24</bibl>.—Also, = vidua, <hi rend="ital">a widow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">censa civium capita centum quatuor milia . . . praeter orbos orbasque,</quote> <trans><tr>orphans and widows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter pupillos et viduas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epit. 59</bibl></cit>; cf. Becker's Antiq. 2, 2, p. 205).—</sense><sense id="n32909.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">deprived</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bereft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destitute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devoid</hi> of any thing, esp. of something precious: arce et urbe orba sum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 114 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">plebs orba tribunis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab optimatibus contio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum litibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio animantibus orba,</quote> <trans><tr>without inhabitants</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 21, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fide pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbus omnibus sensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:5:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubile,</quote> <trans><tr>empty</tr>, <tr>widowed couch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmites,</quote> <trans><tr>bereft of buds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 27</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n32909.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbus auxilique opumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:840" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 840</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 518</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orca: <entryFree id="n32910" type="main" key="orca1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">a)/rxa</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n32910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of whale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an orc</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32910.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32910.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A large-bellied vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a butt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tun</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seria, dolium): orca genus marinae beluae maximum dicitur: ad cujus similitudinem vasa quoque ficaria orcae dicunter: sunt enim teretes, atque uniformi specie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=180" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 180</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">orcae in Hispaniā fervore musti ruptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Byzantia orca (which had contained pickled tunny-fish),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:76" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32910.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A tunnel</hi> used for throwing dice, <hi rend="ital">a dice-box</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">angusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:50" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 50</bibl></cit>: interim dum contemplor orcam, taxillos perdidi, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 615</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. p. 214 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32911" type="main" key="Orca2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. Valerius Orca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 4 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
orcades: <entryFree id="n32912" type="main" key="Orca^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orcădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">islands near Scotland</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Orkneys</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 16, 30, § 103</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orcadas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:161" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 161</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orce: <entryFree id="n32913" type="main" key="orce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orcē</orth>, v. oce</entryFree>
orchamus: <entryFree id="n32914" type="main" key="Orcha^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orchămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/orxamos</foreign>, <sense id="n32914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Babylonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the father of Leucothŏē</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 212</bibl>. <cb n="ORCU" /></sense></entryFree>
orchas: <entryFree id="n32915" type="main" key="orcha^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orchăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of edible olive of an oblong shape</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 86</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orchesta: <entryFree id="n32916" type="greek" key="orche_sta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orchēsta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rxhsth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dancer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pantomime</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">orchestarum loquacissimae manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 4, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orchestopolarius: <entryFree id="n32917" type="gloss" key="orche_sto^po^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orchēstŏpŏlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rxhsto/polos</foreign>, <sense id="n32917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a juggler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumbler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dancer</hi> (postclass.), Firm. Math. 8, 15.</sense></entryFree>
orchestra: <entryFree id="n32918" type="greek" key="orche_stra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orchēstra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rxh/stra</foreign>. <sense id="n32918.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The place where the Senate sat</hi> in the theatre, <hi rend="ital">the orchestra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in orchestrā senatorum sunt sedibus loca destinata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:47" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 21</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n32918.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the Senate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">similesque videbis Orchestram et populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:178" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 178</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32918.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another place on the stage</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=181" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 181</bibl> b; cf. Müll. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
orchion: <entryFree id="n32919" type="greek" key="orchi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orchĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/rxis</foreign>, testiculus, <sense id="n32919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> testiculata, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orchis: <entryFree id="n32920" type="greek" key="orchis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orchis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/rxis</foreign> <sense id="n32920.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of olive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 17:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 18, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32920.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another plant</hi>, so called from the shape of its roots, <hi rend="ital">the orchis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabilis est orchis herba, sive serapias, gemina radice testiculis simili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 62, § 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orchita: <entryFree id="n32921" type="greek" key="orchi_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orchīta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-es</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">orchī-tis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rxi=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n32921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of olive of an oblong shape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">albam pauseam, vel orchitam, vel radiolum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 49, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:1" default="NO">12, 50, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:60" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 60</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=180" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 180</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
orchius: <entryFree id="n32922" type="main" key="Orchi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orchĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens.—So, C. Orchius, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi>, 572 A.U.C., by whom the Lex Orchia was proposed, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 17, 2</bibl>; Schol. Bob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:page=310:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. p. 310, 32</bibl> Bait.</sense></entryFree>
orchomenus: <entryFree id="n32923" type="main" key="Orcho^me^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orchŏmĕnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> or <gen>f.</gen> (and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>), = <foreign lang="greek">*)orxo/menos</foreign>. <sense id="n32923.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The son of Athamas and Themisto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 1" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n32923.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Bœotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 58, 83, § 226</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32923.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Thessaly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minyius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 29</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32923.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Orchŏmĕnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)orxome/nios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Orchomenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 164</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Orchŏmĕnii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Orchomenos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Orchomenians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Lyt. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lyt. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32923.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Arcadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub Orchomenon, Ov, M. 5, 607: Orchomenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orchus: <entryFree id="n32924" type="main" key="Orchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = Orcus: Orchi traditus thesauro, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:24:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 24, 2</bibl>.</entryFree>
orcinianus: <entryFree id="n32925" type="main" key="Orci_ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orcīnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Orcus</etym>, <sense id="n32925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Orcus</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the dead</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sponda,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a bier</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:5:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orcinus: <entryFree id="n32926" type="main" key="Orci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the realms of the dead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberti,</quote> <trans><tr>set free by the last will of their masters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:4:3:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 4, 3, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:8:22" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 33, 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:30:section=12 al" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 40, 5, 30, § 12 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatores,</quote> <trans><tr>who had got into the Senate by means of Cœsar's testament</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orcivius: <entryFree id="n32927" type="main" key="Orcivius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orcivius</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n32927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. C. Orcivius,</quote> <trans><tr>Cicero's colleague as prœtor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 34, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">53, 147</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 48, 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orcula: <entryFree id="n32928" type="main" key="orcu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. orca</etym>, <sense id="n32928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small tun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cask</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">oleas in orculam calcato manibus siccis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 117</bibl></cit>; Auct. de Limit. p. 253 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
orcularis: <entryFree id="n32929" type="main" key="orcu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>orcula</etym>, <sense id="n32929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a cask</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rundlet</hi> (post-class.): termini, Auct. de Limit. p. 251 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
orcus: <entryFree id="n32930" type="main" key="Orcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">e(/rkos</foreign> and the Lat. urgeo: <cit><quote lang="la">Orcum quem dicimus, ait Verrius ab antiquis dictum uragum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=202" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 202</bibl></cit> Müll.—Hence, prop., that which impels, constrains, confines</etym>. <sense id="n32930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Lower World</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the abode of the dead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Orcus</hi>: Acherunsia templa alta Orci, salvete infera, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 6</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 107 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:762" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 762</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minos sedet arbiter Orci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:18:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 18, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 273</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n32930.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32930.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The god of the infernal regions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Orcus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pluto</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orcus recipere ad se hanc noluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene vale, apud Orcum te videbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Verres alter Orcus, venisse Ennam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:50:section=111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 50, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 277</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32930.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Death</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">horriferis accibant vocibus Orcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:996" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 996</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 178</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orcum morari,</quote> <trans><tr>to hesitate to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 27, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapacis Orci fine destinatā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 30</bibl></cit>: cum Orco rationem habere, <hi rend="ital">to risk one's life</hi>, Varr. R. <pb n="1277" /> <cb n="ORDI" /> R. 1, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">janua haec Orci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orcynus: <entryFree id="n32931" type="greek" key="orcy_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orcȳnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/rkunos</foreign>, <sense id="n32931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large seafish of the tunny species</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ordeum: <entryFree id="n32932" type="main" key="orde^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĕum</orth>, and its derivv., v. hord-.</entryFree>
ordia: <entryFree id="n32933" type="main" key="ordi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭa prīma</orth>, <itype>for primordia</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 28</bibl>.</entryFree>
ordinalis: <entryFree id="n32934" type="main" key="ordi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ordo</etym>, <sense id="n32934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that denotes an order of succession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordinal</hi>: nomen, <hi rend="ital">an ordinal numeral</hi> (primus, secundus, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 581</bibl> P. al.</sense></entryFree>
ordinarie: <entryFree id="n32935" type="main" key="ordi^na_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭnārĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ordinarius <sense id="n32935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ordinarius: <entryFree id="n32936" type="main" key="ordi^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ordo</etym>, <sense id="n32936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orderly; according to the usual order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">customary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordinary</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n32936.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n32936.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: ordinarii consules, <hi rend="ital">regular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elected in the usual manner at the beginning of the year</hi> (opp. suffecti), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugiles (with legitimi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinarium hominem Oppius ait dici solitum scurram et improbum ... At Aelius Stilo, qui minime ordine viveret ... Sunt quidam etiam, qui manipularem, quia infimi sit ordinis, appellatum credant ordinarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=182" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 182</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n32936.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n32936.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An overseer who keeps order</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 4, 5</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n32936.5" n="2" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a centurion of the first cohort</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 542, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 15</bibl>; cf. Mommsen, Tribus, p. 123; Anmerk. 112. —</sense><sense id="n32936.6" n="II" level="1"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: oleum, <hi rend="ital">oil obtained in the usual manner from sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ripe olives</hi> (opp. to oleum cibarium, made of bad olives picked up from the ground), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <trans><tr>standing in regular order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:16:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silices,</quote> <trans><tr>stones so laid that those of each row cover the joints of the row beneath it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus,</quote> <trans><tr>regular</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <trans><tr>usual</tr>, <tr>ordinary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 43</bibl></cit>: oratio, <hi rend="ital">regular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connected</hi> (opp. to breviarium or summarium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 39:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 39, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophia non est res succisiva: ordinaria est, domina est,</quote> <trans><tr>it must be constantly practised</tr>, <tr>must govern all the relations of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 53:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 53, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit ordinarium, loqui, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>it was usual</tr>, <tr>customary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:6:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus (opp. to extraordinarium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 14, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭnārĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orderly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">methodically</hi> (eccl. Lat. for ordine, ordinatim), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ordinate: <entryFree id="n32937" type="main" key="ordi^na_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭnātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ordino, <sense id="n32937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ordinatim: <entryFree id="n32938" type="main" key="ordi^na_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭnātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>ordinatus</etym>, <sense id="n32938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in order</hi> or <hi rend="ital">succession; in good order.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32938.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: honores ordinatim petere in re publicā, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 3</bibl>: ille iit passim, ego ordinatim, <hi rend="ital">in good order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with unbroken ranks</hi>, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32938.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">regularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">properly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">musculus ordinatim structus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ordinatio: <entryFree id="n32939" type="main" key="ordi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ordino</etym>, <sense id="n32939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a setting in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regulating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arranging; an order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrangement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regulation</hi> (mostly postAug.). </sense><sense id="n32939.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: architectura constat ex ordinatione, quae Graece <foreign lang="greek">ta/cis</foreign> dicitur, et ex dispositione. Ordinatio est modica membrorum operis commoditas separatim, universaeque proportionis ad symmetriam comparatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2</bibl>.—Of vines, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32939.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32939.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an ordering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regulating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orderly arrangement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 28, 4</bibl></cit>: mundus est ornata ordinatio dei munere, App. de Mundo, 1, p. 251.—</sense><sense id="n32939.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32939.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An orderly regulation of state affairs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">government</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ordinatione civilius? ... quam turpe, si ordinatio eversione, libertas servitute mutetur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 24, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32939.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An appointing to office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">installation</hi> of magistrates, governors: <cit><quote lang="la">cur sibi visum esset ordinatione proximā Aegypto praeficere Metium Rufum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32939.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A regulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordinance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">edict</hi> of an emperor: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rerum omnium ordinatio ... observanda sit, tum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 58</bibl></cit> (66), 10. —</sense><sense id="n32939.8" n="4" level="3"> (Eccl. Lat.) <hi rend="ital">Ordination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">episcopalis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cleri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Bon. Conj. 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 9, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32939.9" n="5" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispositis ordinationibus,</quote> <trans><tr>in ranks</tr>, <tr>rows</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ordinativus: <entryFree id="n32940" type="main" key="ordi^na_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭnātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indicating</hi> or <hi rend="ital">signifying order</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">principatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adverbia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1022</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
ordinator: <entryFree id="n32941" type="main" key="ordi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an orderer</hi>, <cb n="ORDI" /> <hi rend="ital">regulator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arranger</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">litis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>pleader</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 109" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 109</bibl></cit>: omnium, Hilar. Trin. 4, 12, 14.—</sense><sense id="n32941.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ordainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one authorized to ordain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in 2</bibl> Tim. 4, 13.</sense></entryFree>
ordinatrix: <entryFree id="n32942" type="main" key="ordi^na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ordinator</etym>, <sense id="n32942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that orders</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arranges</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mens ordinatrix rerum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 56" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ordinatus: <entryFree id="n32943" type="main" key="ordi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from ordino.</entryFree>
ordino: <entryFree id="n32944" type="main" key="ordi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ordo</etym>, <sense id="n32944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regulate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32944.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: dispenso, dispono): copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,011:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iph. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:9" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 9</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:9:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbusta latius sulcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineam paribus intervallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res suas suo arbitrio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:14:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 10, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 12, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:25" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 40, 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibliothecas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32944.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditates improbas,</quote> <trans><tr>to arrange</tr>, <tr>draw up in order of battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 10:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: publicas res (= <foreign lang="greek">sunta/ttein</foreign>, componere), <hi rend="ital">to draw up in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to narrate the history of public events</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 10</bibl> (antiquitatem) totam in eo volumine exposuerit, quo magistratus ordinavit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">recorded events according to the years of the magistrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 18, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnia ordinarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 19, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32944.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n32944.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">govern</hi> a country: <cit><quote lang="la">statum liberarum civitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32944.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To ordain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appoint to office</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunatus, praefecturas, et ducatus,</quote> <trans><tr>to dispose of</tr>, <tr>give away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">filium in successionem regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32944.6" n="C" level="2"> (Eccl. Lat.) <hi rend="ital">To ordain</hi> as a priest or pastor, <hi rend="ital">to admit to a clerical office</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 9, 36</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in ministerium sanctorum ordinaverunt se ipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 16, 15</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭ-nātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">well ordered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orderly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appointed</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">compositus ordinatusque vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">igneae formae cursus ordinatos definiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>perform their appointed courses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 101</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita ordinatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars mundi ordinatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meatus ordinatissimi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socrat. p. 42</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭnā-tē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an orderly manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">methodically</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 811; <cit><quote lang="la">v. ordinatim): tamquam (astra) non possent tam disposite, tam ordinate moveri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinate disponere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 56, 69</bibl></cit> dub.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinatius retractare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 19</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.—Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinatissime subjunxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 1:24" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Retract. 1, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ordior: <entryFree id="n32945" type="main" key="ordi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ordĭor</orth>, <itype>orsus, 4</itype> (<sense id="n32945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> ordibor for ordiar: non parvam rem ordibor, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 39, 22</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> orditus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 25, 7</bibl>), <pos>v. dep.</pos>, lit., <hi rend="ital">to begin a web</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lay the warp;</hi> hence, also, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertake</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ordiri est rei principium facere, unde et togae vocantur exordiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=185" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 185</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 29, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">telam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 9, 30, v. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 25, 7</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n32945.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to weave</hi> a web, <hi rend="ital">to weave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">araneus orditur telas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 80</bibl></cit>.—So of the Fates: <cit><quote lang="la">Lachesis plenā orditur manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Parca) hominis vitam orditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 10, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32945.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertake</hi> (class.; syn.: incipio, incoho, infit); constr. with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32945.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquas res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterius vitae quoddam initium ordimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquos,</quote> <trans><tr>to relate</tr>, <tr>describe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querelae ab initio tantae ordiendae rei absint. Liv. praef. § 12: majorem orsa furorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 386</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32945.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo altius de re ordiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:47:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 47, § 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32945.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, de quā disputare ordimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum adulescens orsus esset in foro dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 88, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sic orsa loqui vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et orsa est Dicere Leuconoë,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc sic orsa loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:320" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 320</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32945.6" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">have a beginning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde est orsa, in eodem terminetur oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 11, 33</bibl></cit>: Veneris contra sic filius orsus, <hi rend="ital">thus began</hi> (to speak), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 325</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic Juppiter orsus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 806</bibl></cit>; so commonly with specification of <cb n="ORDO" /> the point from which: <cit><quote lang="la">unde ordiri rectius possumus quam a naturā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 37 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a principio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a facillimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 83, § 132</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Of things or subjects, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be begun</hi> (where the verb may be taken in pass. sense): <cit><quote lang="la">tormina ab atrā bile orsa mortifera sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex depressiore loco fuerint orsa fundamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: sed ab initio est ordiendus (Themistocles), i. e. <hi rend="ital">I must begin</hi> (<hi rend="ital">his life</hi>) <hi rend="ital">at the beginning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 1, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eo nobis causa ordienda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:7:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orditus: <entryFree id="n32946" type="main" key="ordi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ordītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from ordior.</entryFree>
ordo: <entryFree id="n32947" type="main" key="ordo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ordo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from root or-; Sanscr. ar-, to go, strive upward; cf. orior, through an adj. stem ordo-; v. Corss. Krit. Beitr. p. 108</etym>, <sense id="n32947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a regular row</hi>, <hi rend="ital">line</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">series</hi>, <hi rend="ital">methodical arrangement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi> (class.; syn.: series, tenor). </sense><sense id="n32947.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinem sic definiunt compositionem rerum aptis et accommodatis locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 40, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis ordinis et collocationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores in ordinem satae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>planted in a quincunx</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Caecil. 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 17, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32947.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">right order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regular succession</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatum appello ordinem seriemque causarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:55:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 55, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil esse pulchrius in omni ratione vitae dispositione atque ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibere modum quendam et ordinem rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox referam me ad ordinem,</quote> <trans><tr>will soon bring myself to order</tr>, <tr>return to order</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res in ordinem redigere,</quote> <trans><tr>to reduce to order</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct.
