Her.</author> 3, 9, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in ordinem adducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinem conservare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eundem tenere,</quote> <trans><tr>to preserve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:244" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 69, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immutare,</quote> <trans><tr>to change</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:214" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 63, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perturbare,</quote> <trans><tr>to disturb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:223" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 223</bibl></cit>: cogere or redigere in ordinem, <hi rend="ital">to reduce to order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to humble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">degrade</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decemviri querentes, se in ordinem cogi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 23, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in ordinem redactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: gula reprimenda et quasi in ordinem redigenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32947.3" n="C" level="2"> Adverb. expressions. </sense><sense id="n32947.4" n="1" level="3"> Ordine, in ordinem, per ordinem, in ordine, ex ordine, <hi rend="ital">in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in turn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hegioni rem enarrato omnem ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae in ordinem confectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordine cuncta exposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortiti nocte singuli per ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos Corydon, illos referebat in ordine Thyrsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 629</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque aetate et honore antecedebat, ita sententiam dixit ex ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:64:section=143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 64, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordine se vocante,</quote> <trans><tr>when his turn came</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 2, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ordine vicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32947.5" n="2" level="3"> Ordine, <hi rend="ital">regularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">properly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ut quidque Egisti ordine scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem demonstravi ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 17</bibl> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">an id recte, ordine, e re publicā factum esse defendes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:84:section=194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 84, § 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc recte atque ordine factum videtur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 7, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32947.6" n="3" level="3"> Ex ordine, <hi rend="ital">in succession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without intermission</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vendit Italiae possessiones ex ordine omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem illum totos perhibent ex ordine menses Flevisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 507</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 773</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32947.7" n="4" level="3"> Extra ordinem. </sense><sense id="n32947.8" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Out of course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in an unusual</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extraordinary manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra ordinem decernere provinciam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina probantur,</quote> <trans><tr>in an illegal manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:1:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32947.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Extraordinarily</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">uncommonly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eam spem, quam extra ordinem de te ipso habemus, accedunt tua praecipua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32947.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> concr. </sense><sense id="n32947.11" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n32947.12" n="1" level="3"> Tres ordines lapidum, <hi rend="ital">three courses of stones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 6, 36</bibl>.—In building, <hi rend="ital">a row</hi>, <hi rend="ital">course</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">layer</hi> of stones, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">obstructis in speciem portis singulis ordinibus caespitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius insuper ordo adicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: tot premit ordinibus caput, <hi rend="ital">tiers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">layers</hi> of ornaments, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:502" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 502</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n32947.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A row of benches</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seats</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terno consurgunt ordine remi,</quote> <trans><tr>in three rows of oar-banks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex ordinum navem invenit Xenagoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 208</bibl></cit>.—In the theatre, <hi rend="ital">a row of seats</hi>: post senatores ex vetere instituto quatuordecim graduum ordines equestri ordini assignati fuere, Suet. <pb n="1278" /> <cb n="ORES" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:44" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedisti in quatuordecim ordinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32947.14" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A train</hi> of servants or attendants: <cit><quote lang="la">comitum longissimus ordo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:284" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 284</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32947.15" n="B" level="2"> In milit. lang. </sense><sense id="n32947.16" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A line</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rank</hi> of soldiers in battle array: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia regis nullo ordine iter fecerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quisquam ordine egrederetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 45, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo ordine commutato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 101:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 101, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine signis, sine ordinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 97:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 97, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">signa atque ordines observare,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep the ranks</tr>, <tr>remain in line</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 51:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 51, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conturbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 51, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32947.17" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">company</hi> of soldiers: <cit><quote lang="la">viri fortissimi atque honestissimi, qui ordines duxerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>who have led companies</tr>, <tr>have been officers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Pupius primipili centurio, qui hunc eundem ordinem in exercitu Pompeii antea duxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 13</bibl></cit>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n32947.18" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A captaincy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a command</hi>: ordinem alicui adimere, Tab. Heracl. ap. Mazoch. p. 423, n. 47; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">on the contrary: alicui assignare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">DARE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3456</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriones ad superiores ordines transducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32947.19" n="(b)" level="5"> Ordines, <hi rend="ital">chieftains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">captains</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunis militum primisque ordinibus convocatis,</quote> <trans><tr>the captains of the first companies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32947.20" n="C" level="2"> In a polit. respect, <hi rend="ital">an order</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a rank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">class</hi>, <hi rend="ital">degree</hi> of citizens: <cit><quote lang="la">et meus med ordo inrideat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit>.—In the time of Cicero there were three principal classes, ordo senatorius, equester, and plebeius: <cit><quote lang="la">Fidiculanius cujus erat ordinis? senatoril,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:37:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 37, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 18, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximus est huic dignitati equester ordo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:28:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 28, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferiores loco, auctoritate, ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:48:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 48, § 127</bibl></cit>: ordo amplissimus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Senate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem absentem in amplissimum ordinem cooptarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also termed SPLENDIDISSIMVS ORDO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1180</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1181</bibl>; and simply ordo, <hi rend="ital">the order</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">the Senate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo Mutinensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 425, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trecentos ex dediticiis electos utriusque ordinis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the two upper classes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32947.21" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a class</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mearum me rerum aequom'st novisse ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratorum, pecuariorum, mercatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ornatissimus loco, ordine, nomine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">127: libertini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 18</bibl></cit>.—So in the inscrr.: SACERDOTVM, HARVSPICVM, etc., Grut. 320, 12; 304, 7; 302, 2 et saep.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">grammatici alios auctores in ordinem redigerunt, alios omnino exemerant numero,</quote> <trans><tr>recognized among</tr>, <tr>placed in the rank of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32947.22" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp. (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">an order in the church</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ecclesiastical rank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">office</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines sacerdotum et Levitarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Esdr. 13, 30: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum ordinem Melchisedek,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:109:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 109, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ordovices: <entryFree id="n32948" type="main" key="Ordovices"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ordovices</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Britain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 18, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oreae: <entryFree id="n32949" type="main" key="o_re^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrĕae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. os</etym>, <sense id="n32949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bit</hi> of a bridle (ante-class.), Titin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=182" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 182</bibl> Müll.: oreas equo detrahere, Cael. ib.</sense></entryFree>
oreas: <entryFree id="n32950" type="main" key="O^re_a^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrēăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)oreia/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountainnymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Oread</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quam mille secutae Hinc atque hinc glomerantur Oreades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 500</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 787</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:136" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 136</bibl>; cf. Oreos.</sense></entryFree>
oreon: <entryFree id="n32951" type="greek" key="o^re_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrēon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrīon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/reion</foreign>, <sense id="n32951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain-plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of</hi> polygonos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 91, § 115</bibl></sense></entryFree>
oreos: <entryFree id="n32952" type="gloss" key="O^re_os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrēos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/reios</foreign>, <sense id="n32952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the mountain</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Pan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oreos Liber pater, et Oreades Nymphae appellantur, quod in montibus frequenter apparent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=182" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 182</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
oreoselinon: <entryFree id="n32953" type="greek" key="o^re^o^se^li_non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrĕŏsĕlīnon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)reose/linon</foreign>, <sense id="n32953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mountain-parsley</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 37, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oresitrophos: <entryFree id="n32954" type="main" key="O^re^si_tro^phos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrĕsītrŏphos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)oresi/trofos</foreign> (mountain-fed), <sense id="n32954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of Actœon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 233</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orestae: <entryFree id="n32955" type="main" key="O^restae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrestae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ore/stai</foreign>, <sense id="n32955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orestes: <entryFree id="n32956" type="main" key="O^restes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrestes</orth>, <itype>is and ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ore/sths</foreign>, <sense id="n32956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of Agamemnon and Clytœmnestra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who avenged his father's death by slaying his mother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in company with his faithful friend Pylades and his sister Iphigenia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">priestess of Diana in the Tauric Chersonese</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carried away the image of Diana to Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Aricia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agamemnonius Orestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 471</bibl></cit>: <cb n="ORIC" /> dico vicisse Oresten, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 306, 28</bibl> (Trag. v. 191 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum Pylades Orestem se esse diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamantem nomen Orestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fuit Argolico juvenis Phoceus Orestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit> (vulg. Oresti).—<hi rend="ital">Voc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis Oresta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32956.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a tragedy of Euripides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founded on the story of Orestes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Orestem fabulam doceret Euripides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:29:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 29, 63</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32956.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Orestē-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)orestei=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Orestes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Orestean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diana,</quote> <trans><tr>whose image was carried away by Orestes to Aricia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 489</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orestiades: <entryFree id="n32957" type="gloss" key="O^resti^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrestĭădes</orth>, <itype>nymphae montium cultrices</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=185" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 185</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
orestilla: <entryFree id="n32958" type="main" key="Orestilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orestilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female surname in the</hi> gens <hi rend="ital">Aurelia;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">Aurelia Orestilla</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Catiline</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orestion: <entryFree id="n32959" type="main" key="o^resti^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrestĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n32959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> helenion <hi rend="ital">and</hi> nectarea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orestis: <entryFree id="n32960" type="main" key="O^restis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrestis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 16, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oretani: <entryFree id="n32961" type="main" key="O_re_ta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōrētāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)wrhtanoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n32961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Oretum in Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oreus: <entryFree id="n32962" type="main" key="O_re_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōrēus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Eubœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly Histiœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 40, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 21, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orexis: <entryFree id="n32963" type="greek" key="o^rexis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrexis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/recis</foreign>, <sense id="n32963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a longing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appetite</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">rabidam facturus orexim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:428" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc surgit orexis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orexin,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
organalis: <entryFree id="n32964" type="main" key="orga^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orgănālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> <etym>organum</etym>, <sense id="n32964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to the organ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">organ-</hi>: fistulae, Mythogr. Lat. 3, 12.</sense></entryFree>
organarius: <entryFree id="n32965" type="main" key="orga^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orgănārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a musical-instrument maker</hi> (post-class.), Firm. Math. 3, 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
organicus: <entryFree id="n32966" type="greek" key="orga^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orgănĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rganiko/s</foreign>. <sense id="n32966.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to implements</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mechanical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">telarum organica administratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32966.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to musical-instruments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instrumental</hi>, <hi rend="ital">musical</hi>: alterum (melos), quod vocant organicon, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 77, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32966.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">orgănĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a musician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 334</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:412" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 412</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
organum: <entryFree id="n32967" type="greek" key="orga^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orgănum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/rganon</foreign>, <sense id="n32967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an implement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instrument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engine</hi> of any kind (mostly post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 12</bibl>.—Of military or architectonic engines (whereas machina denotes one of a larger size and more complicated construction), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1</bibl>.—Of musical instruments, <hi rend="ital">a pipe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:10" default="NO">9, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:3:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 3, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:34:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Par. 34, 12</bibl> et saep.—Of hydraulic engines, <hi rend="ital">an organ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">water-organ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">organa hydraulica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 41</bibl></cit>: aquatica, Mythogr. Lat. 3, 12.—Of <hi rend="ital">a church-organ</hi>, Cass. Expos. in Psa. 150; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Enarr. in Psa. 150" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Enarr. in Psa. 150</bibl>, n. 7.— </sense><sense id="n32967.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: organum oris, <hi rend="ital">the tongue</hi> of a man, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 2.—</sense><sense id="n32967.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an implement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instrument</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orgessum: <entryFree id="n32968" type="main" key="Orgessum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orgessum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n32968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a castle in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orgetorix: <entryFree id="n32969" type="main" key="Orge^to^rix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orgĕtŏrix</orth>, <itype>ĭgis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chief of the Helvetii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2 sq.</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
orgia: <entryFree id="n32970" type="main" key="Orgi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orgĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/orgia</foreign>, <sense id="n32970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nocturnal festival in honor of Bacchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accompanied by wild bacchanalian cries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the feast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">orgies of Bacchus.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32970.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 303</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 521</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32970.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">secret frantic revels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orgies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:91" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32970.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Itala per Graios Orgia ferre choros,</quote> <trans><tr>the mysteries of love in the Latin tongue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <trans><tr>secrets</tr>, <tr>mysteries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:217" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 217</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orgiophanta: <entryFree id="n32971" type="main" key="Orgi^o^phanta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orgĭŏphanta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)orgiofa/nths</foreign>, <sense id="n32971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a presider over the orgies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an orgiophant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">SACERDOTES ORGIOPHANTAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 66, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orgus: <entryFree id="n32972" type="main" key="Orgus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Upper Italy</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Orco</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> Carm 1, 38</bibl></sense></entryFree>
oria: <entryFree id="n32973" type="main" key="o^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrĭa</orth>, v horia.</entryFree>
oribasus: <entryFree id="n32974" type="main" key="O^ri_ba^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrībăsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)orei/basos</foreign> (mountain-climber), <sense id="n32974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of Actœon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 210</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oribata: <entryFree id="n32975" type="greek" key="o^ri_ba^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrībăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)reiba/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n32975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain-climber</hi> (post-class.), Firm. Math. 8, 17.</sense></entryFree>
orichalcum: <entryFree id="n32976" type="greek" key="o^ri^chalcum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrĭchalcum</orth> (also erroneously written <orth extent="full" lang="la">aurĭchalcum</orth>, as if from aurum), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rei/xalkos</foreign>, <sense id="n32976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">yellow copper ore</hi>, also the <hi rend="ital">brass</hi> made from it. </sense><sense id="n32976.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 23, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 202</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">album,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 87</bibl></cit>.—It was highly prized by the ancients, <cb n="ORIG" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 2, § 4</bibl> (al. aurichalci). —</sense><sense id="n32976.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">brass implements.</hi>—So of <hi rend="ital">a brazen</hi> tuba, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:61" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 61</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">arms of brass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:660" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 660</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oricilla: <entryFree id="n32977" type="hapax" key="o_ri^cilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrĭcilla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">aur-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>auricula, auris</etym>, <sense id="n32977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ear-lap</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollior ... imula oricilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oricos: <entryFree id="n32978" type="main" key="O_ri^cos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōrĭcos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōrĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōrĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)wriko/s</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*)wriko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n32978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seaport town of Illyria Grœca</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ericho</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 8 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 187</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32978.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōrĭcīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Oricum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Oricians</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oricinorum fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 25</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32978.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōrĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Oricum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Orician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oricia terebinthus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 136</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oricula: <entryFree id="n32979" type="main" key="o_ri^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrĭcŭla</orth>, v. auricula</entryFree>
oricularius: <entryFree id="n32980" type="main" key="o_ri^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. auric-.</entryFree>
oricum: <entryFree id="n32981" type="main" key="O_ri^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōrĭcum</orth>, v. Oricos.</entryFree>
oridurius: <entryFree id="n32982" type="gloss" key="o_ri^du_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrĭdūrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. os-durus</etym>, <sense id="n32982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hard-mouthed</hi>, of horses: oridurius, <foreign lang="greek">sklhro/stomos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
oriens: <entryFree id="n32983" type="main" key="o^ri^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. orior.</entryFree>
orientalis: <entryFree id="n32984" type="main" key="o^ri^enta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrĭentālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>oriens</etym>, <sense id="n32984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the East</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Eastern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Oriental</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">periculorum et operum orientalium socii,</quote> <trans><tr>in the East</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barba ria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 38, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32984.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n32984.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrĭentā-les</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Orientals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 3, 9</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n32984.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrĭentāles</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. ferae), <hi rend="ital">wild beasts designed for hunting exhibitions</hi> (as lions, tigers, panthers, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 654, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orificium: <entryFree id="n32985" type="main" key="o_ri^fi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrĭfĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. os-facio</etym>, <sense id="n32985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an opening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orifice</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ventris sunt duo orificia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cistulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 236, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>, p. 262, 27.</sense></entryFree>
origa: <entryFree id="n32986" type="main" key="o_ri_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrīga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, an old form for auriga, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:8:4" default="NO">2, 8, 4</bibl> Schneid.</entryFree>
origanitus: <entryFree id="n32987" type="main" key="o^ri_ga^ni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrīgănītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>origanum</etym>: vini sextarium origaniti, <sense id="n32987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine spiced with</hi> origanum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 127, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
origanum: <entryFree id="n32988" type="greek" key="o^ri_ga^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrīgănum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrī-gănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rei/ganon, o)ri/ganon</foreign>, and <foreign lang="greek">o)rei/ganos</foreign>, or <foreign lang="greek">o)ri/ganos</foreign>, <sense id="n32988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant wild-marjoram</hi>, <hi rend="ital">origan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 67, § 175</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 47, 879</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
origenes: <entryFree id="n32989" type="main" key="O_ri^ge^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōrĭgĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)wrige/nhs</foreign>, <sense id="n32989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Origen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a famous Greek Christian writer of the early part of the third century</hi>, A.D., <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 100</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 17.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōrĭgĕnistes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a follower of Origen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 84, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl> in <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
originalis: <entryFree id="n32990" type="main" key="o^ri_gi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrīgĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>origo</etym>, <sense id="n32990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">primitive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">original</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Ceres frugum parens originalis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recurram ad originales libros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Gal. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum species,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: coloni, Cod. Th. 11, 1, 14.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrīgĭnālĭ-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">originally</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 3:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 1:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Retract. 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
originarius: <entryFree id="n32991" type="main" key="o^ri_gi^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrīgĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">original</hi> (post-class.): colonus, Cod. Th. 11, 48, 7.—</sense><sense id="n32991.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrigĭnārii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">original inhabitants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aborigines</hi>, Cod. Th. 10, 38.</sense></entryFree>
originatio: <entryFree id="n32992" type="main" key="o^ri_gi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrīgĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the derivation of words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">etymology</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
originitus: <entryFree id="n32993" type="main" key="o^ri_gi^ni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrīgĭnĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">originally</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">Persae, qui sunt originitus Scythae,</quote> <trans><tr>by origin</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
origo: <entryFree id="n32994" type="main" key="o^ri_go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>orior</etym>, <sense id="n32994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">earliest beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commencement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">source</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lineage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">origin</hi> (class.; syn. ortus). </sense><sense id="n32994.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32994.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">originem rerum quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">origo tyranni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:29:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 29, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principii nulla est origo: nam e principio oriuntur omnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 25, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullius autem rei causā remotā reperiri origo potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum genitalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab origine gentem (corripiunt morbi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summi boni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin 2, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium virtutum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontium qui celat origines Nilus,</quote> <trans><tr>source</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctore ab aliquo ducere originem,</quote> <trans><tr>to derive one's origin from</tr>, <tr>to descend from</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis causa malae est origo penes te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:226" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <trans><tr>to take its origin</tr>, <tr>originate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere ex Hispaniā,</quote> <trans><tr>to be of Spanish derivation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 57</bibl></cit>: deducere ab aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to derive one's origin from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descend from</hi>, Plin. <pb n="1279" /> <cb n="ORIO" /> 6, 20, 23, § <cit><quote lang="la">76: ab aliquo habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw one's origin from</tr>, <tr>descend from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:15:14:15:section=49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:24:21:section=86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 24, 21, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">PATRONVS AB ORIGINE,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from his ancestors</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 101</bibl></cit>, n. 232.—</sense><sense id="n32994.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: <cit><quote lang="la">Origines,</quote> <trans><tr>the title of a work by Cato upon the early history of the Italian cities</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cat. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (M. Cato) in principio scripsit Originum suarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 27, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 38</bibl>.—Hence, in allusion to this title: quam ob rem, ut ille solebat, ita nunc mea repetet oratio populi origines; <cit><quote lang="la">libenter enim etiam verbo utor Catonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32994.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32994.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">family</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille tamen nostrā deducit origine nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vitelliorum originem alii aliam tradunt: partim veterem et nobilem, partim vero novam et obscuram, atque etiam sordidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 1</bibl></cit>.—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 473</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n32994.6" n="B" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">an ancestor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progenitor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneas, Romanae stirpis origo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celebrant carminibus antiquis Tuisconem deum terrā editum, et filium Mannum, originem gentis conditoresque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus origo Ilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi melioris origo,</quote> <trans><tr>the creator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 79</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:680" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 680</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eaeque (urbes) brevi multum auctae, pars originibus suis praesidio, aliae decori fuere,</quote> <trans><tr>their mother-cities</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 19, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:39" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 39</bibl>; also in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 23, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32995" type="main" key="O^ri_go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orinda: <entryFree id="n32996" type="greek" key="o^rinda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrinda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)ri/ndhs</foreign> <sense id="n32996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Ethiopian bread</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orine: <entryFree id="n32997" type="main" key="O^ri_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrīnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Orine</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)oreinh/</foreign>, sc. <foreign lang="greek">gh=</foreign> (the hill country). </sense><sense id="n32997.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A region of Judea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 14, 15, § 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32997.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1295, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oriola: <entryFree id="n32998" type="main" key="o^ri^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrĭŏla</orth>, i. q. horiola, q. v.</entryFree>
orion: <entryFree id="n32999" type="main" key="O_ri_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōrīon</orth> (Ŏrīōn, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 535</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 52</bibl>), ŏnis and <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)wri/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n32999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the constellation Orion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose rising and setting are attended by storms;</hi> acc. to the myth, <hi rend="ital">a hunter</hi> transported to heaven, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:493" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 493</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 195" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 535</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 27, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 5, 21</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
orior: <entryFree id="n33000" type="main" key="o^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrĭor</orth>, <itype>ortus</itype>, <sense id="n33000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. part.</hi> oriturus, 4 (but with some forms of the 3d conj.: orĭtur, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=305" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 305</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:17:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 17, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 411</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">680</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 774</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">oreris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:166" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 166</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">imperat.</hi> orere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 7</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">impf. subj.</hi> oreretur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 15, 59</bibl>; and oreretur and orerentur are the more usual forms in the best MSS.; cf. Haase in Reisig's Vorles. p. 251; Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 418 sq.), <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>root or.; Sanscr. ar-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)/rnumi, o)ri/nw</foreign>; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. 348 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. 348 sq.</bibl></etym>. </sense><sense id="n33000.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., of persons, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestir one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get up</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">consul oriens nocte diceret dictatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33000.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., of the heavenly bodies, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become visible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae, ut quaeque oriturque caditque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:295" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortā luce,</quote> <trans><tr>in the morning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orto sole,</quote> <trans><tr>at sunrise</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postera lux oritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: crassa pulvis oritur, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 205, 28</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n33000.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to come forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become visible; to have one's origin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">descent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descend</hi> from; <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spring forth; to rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take its origin; arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originate</hi> (syn. nascor): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quis non credat abs te esse ortum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenus oritur ex Lepontiis,</quote> <trans><tr>takes its rise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeander ex arce summā Celaenarum ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tigris oritur in montibus Uxiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons oritur in monte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Durius amnis oritur in Pelendonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 20, 34, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis Indus in Cibyratarum jugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 28, 29, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi Caicus amnis oritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incliti amnes Caucaso monte orti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenus Alpium vertice ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oritur controversia,</quote> <trans><tr>arises</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:69:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 69, 161</bibl></cit>: unde oritur nox, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=193" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 193</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 407 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrum mirabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea officia. quae oriuntur a suo cujusque genere virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id facmus ex te ortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi a me nulla orta est injuria,</quote> <trans><tr>I have caused you no injury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: quod si numquam oritur, ne occidit quidem umquam,<cb n="ORME" />  <hi rend="ital">comes into being</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:24:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 24, 27</bibl>. —Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to be born</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (solo) tu ortus et procreatus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueros orientes animari,</quote> <trans><tr>at birth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 42, 89</bibl></cit>: ex concubina, Sal. J. 108, 1; <hi rend="ital">to be descended from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerosque Belgas esse ortos a Germanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take its beginning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliquo sermo oritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33000.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst. m.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33000.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The rising sun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morning sun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et me saevus equis oriens afflavit anhelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 739</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 250</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33000.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The quarter where the sun rises</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the East</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Orient</hi> (opp. to occidens, the West, the Occident): <cit><quote lang="la">ab oriente ad occidentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestivus,</quote> <trans><tr>the quarter where the sun rises in summer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vernus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33000.7" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">day</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">septimus hinc oriens cum se demiserit undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:653" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 653</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33000.8" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">sprung</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, and (partic. with poets and since the Aug. per.) with simple <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n33000.9" n="(a)" level="5"> Class. usually with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a me ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam ab illo (Catone) ortus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 31, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maternum genus ab regibus ortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a liberatoribus patriae ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32, 13</bibl></cit>: homo a se ortus, <hi rend="ital">without noble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">famous ancestors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego a me ortus et per me nixus (opp. adjuvari commendatione majorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 27, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 6, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33000.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Less freq. with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and name of person: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Tantalo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 57</bibl></cit>; but with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and the name of a place, family, order, class, etc., freq. and class.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eodem loco ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortus ex eā familiā, quā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex concubinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:108:1" default="NO" valid="yes">108, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex patricio sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 40, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33000.11" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> alone (except with loco and genere, mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">eā familiā ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orte Saturno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 33</bibl>: 4, 6, 32: <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortus sorore ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paelice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 53, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orti Atticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquis nobilibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanicum Druso ortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thessalis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 34</bibl></cit>; 12, 53; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 72: regiā stirpe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppido Ferentino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equestri familiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis e centurionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oripelargus: <entryFree id="n33001" type="greek" key="o^ri_pe^largus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrīpĕlargus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)reipelargo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mountain-stork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oriputidus: <entryFree id="n33002" type="gloss" key="o_ri^pu_ti^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrĭpūtĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. os-putidus</etym>, <sense id="n33002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has a stinking mouth</hi>: oriputidus, <foreign lang="greek">o)zo/stomos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
oritae: <entryFree id="n33003" type="main" key="Oritae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oritae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nation of Ichthyophagi</hi>, on the borders of India, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 30</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 23, 25, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orites: <entryFree id="n33004" type="main" key="o^ri_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. oritis.</entryFree>
orithyia: <entryFree id="n33005" type="main" key="O_ri_thy_i_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōrīthȳīa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quadrisyl.</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)wrei/quia</foreign>, <sense id="n33005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33005.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Erechtheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Athens; who became by Boreas the mother of Calaïs and Zetes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 683</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 463</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:5:16" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33005.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A queen of the Amazons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:17" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oritis: <entryFree id="n33006" type="greek" key="o^ri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)ri=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n33006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi> (by some called sideritis), otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 65, § 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oriundus: <entryFree id="n33007" type="main" key="o^ri^undus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrĭundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>orior</etym>. <sense id="n33007.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Descended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprung</hi> from any person or place (rare but class.): o sanguen dis oriundum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 41</bibl> (Ann. v. 117 Vahl.): Poenos Didone oriundos, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 685</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 300 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">caelesti semine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:991" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 991</bibl></cit>: ab ingenuis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:6:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 6, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Etruscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberis parentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde oriundi sient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod inde oriundus erat, plebi carus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33007.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originating in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">springing from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud repudio Carthaginem: inde sum oriundus,</quote> <trans><tr>I was born there</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oriundi ab Syracusis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ORIVNDVS LEPTI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Don.</author> 6, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ORIVNDVS GAZA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 168</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">Egone apicularum congestum opera non feram, Ex dulci oriundum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluens aqua e montibus oriunda,</quote> <trans><tr>derived</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albā oriundum sacerdotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ormenis: <entryFree id="n33008" type="main" key="Orme^ni^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ormĕnĭs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)wrmeni/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the female descendant</hi> (granddaughter) <hi rend="ital">of Ormenius</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Astydamia; voc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ormeni nympha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 50</bibl></cit>. <cb n="ORNA" /></sense></entryFree>
ormenos: <entryFree id="n33009" type="main" key="orme^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ormĕnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of samphire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 61, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orminalis: <entryFree id="n33010" type="main" key="ormi_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ormīnālis</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">hormīnālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>horminum</etym>, <sense id="n33010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> satyrion, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orminos: <entryFree id="n33011" type="main" key="orminos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orminos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wild asparagus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 10, 43, § 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ornamen: <entryFree id="n33012" type="spur" key="orna_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ornāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>orno</etym>, an old reading for ornamentum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 587</bibl>.</entryFree>
