ornamentarius: <entryFree id="n33013" type="gloss" key="orna_menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ornāmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ornamentum</etym>, <sense id="n33013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adorned with the insignia of an office</hi>, without filling the office itself: DECVRIO, Inscr. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> 349, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ornamentum: <entryFree id="n33014" type="main" key="orna_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ornāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>orno</etym>. <sense id="n33014.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">apparatus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accoutrement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equipment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furniture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trappings</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sine ornamentis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>naked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterae copiae, ornamenta, praesidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:32:section=83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 32, § 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta bubus, ornamenta asinis instrata tria (collar, saddle, etc.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ornamenta percussus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 14, 14</bibl></cit>.—Esp of a <hi rend="ital">player's wardrobe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:16 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 16 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 3, 4, § 8</bibl>, as translation of <foreign lang="greek">ko/smos</foreign>.—</sense><sense id="n33014.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an ornamental equipment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark of honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decoration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jewel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trinket.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33014.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam, omniaque ornamenta ex fano Herculis in oppidum contulit,</quote> <trans><tr>jewels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 18</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 7, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (urbs) praesidio et ornamento est civitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse ornamenta a chorago haec sumpsit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a dress</tr>, <tr>costume</tr>, <tr>attire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">AB ORNAMEN TIS,</quote> <trans><tr>one who has charge of the imperial ornaments</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 578, 9</bibl></cit>: ornamenta triumphalia, consularia, etc., <hi rend="ital">the insignia of triumphing generals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consuls</hi>, etc. (The emperors distributed, honoris causā, such ornaments to men who had distinguished themselves): <cit><quote lang="la">pluribus triumphalia ornamenta decernenda curavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem praetoriis viris consularia ornamenta tribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta uxoria,</quote> <trans><tr>title</tr>, <tr>rank</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33014.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a distinction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decus atque ornamentum senectutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Hortensius, lumen atque ornamentum rei publicae,</quote> <trans><tr>ornament</tr>, <tr>pride</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 14, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir optimus, et inter praecipua saeculi ornamenta numerandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamentis afficere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque a me ornamenta ad te proficiscentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta atque insignia honoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 31, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33014.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">rhetorical ornament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratoria ornamenta dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:261" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 75, 261</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">37, 140</bibl>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 37, 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ornate: <entryFree id="n33015" type="main" key="orna_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ornātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. orno, <sense id="n33015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ornatio: <entryFree id="n33016" type="main" key="orna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ornātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>orno</etym>, <sense id="n33016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an adorning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adornment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi> (not ante-Aug., and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 8, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornationes templi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 775</bibl></cit>: STATVAE, Inscr. ap. Nov. Lett. di Firenze, t. ii. p. 600.</sense></entryFree>
ornator: <entryFree id="n33017" type="main" key="orna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ornātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n33017.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An adorner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dresser</hi> (not ante-Aug., and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">deorum ornatores, Firm. Astron. 3, 6, 9: HVIVS LOCI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3171</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33017.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An office under the emperors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ORNATOR GLABR. (i. e. glabrorum, puerorum delicatorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 694</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ornatrix: <entryFree id="n33018" type="main" key="orna_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ornātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ornator</etym>, <sense id="n33018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female adorner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tire-woman</hi>, a slave who dressed her mistress's hair (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in inscrr.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 239</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matris meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2878</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2933</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4443</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:477" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 477</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ornatulus: <entryFree id="n33019" type="main" key="orna_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ornātŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n33019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [ornatus], <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smart</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">muliercula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:Fragm. p. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. Fragm. p. 19</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
ornatura: <entryFree id="n33020" type="main" key="orna_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ornātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>orno</etym>, <sense id="n33020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trimming</hi>, esp. of the borders of a fine dress (post-class.), Edict. Diocl. p. 20.</sense></entryFree>
ornatus: <entryFree id="n33021" type="main" key="orna_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ornātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from orno.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33022" type="main" key="orna_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ornātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n33022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> ornati, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 28</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> ornatu, C. Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:16:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 16, 8</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>orno</etym> (class.; cf.: cultus, munditia), <hi rend="ital">a furnishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">providing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparing; a preparation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33022.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33022.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in ornat bus publicis (i. e. epulis, conviviis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: in aedibus nihil ornati, <hi rend="ital">no preparation</hi> (for the wed ding), Ter And. 2, 2, 28: Pompeiis emptus <pb n="1280" /> <cb n="ORNO" /> ornatus (trapeti), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 22, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33022.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an adornment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decoration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">portarum, itinerum, locorumque omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:51" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 51</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33022.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in concr., <hi rend="ital">splendid dress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apparel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus appellatur cultus ipse, quo quis ornatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=184" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 184</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">nauclericus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide ornatus hic satine me condecet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus regio ornatu instructus,</quote> <trans><tr>trappings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 64, § 154</bibl></cit> dub. (Jan.: regio instratu ornatus).—So of a woman's <hi rend="ital">head-dress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis ornatum exuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:321" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 321</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33022.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33022.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">furniture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accoutrements</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equipage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia quocumque ingreditur, eodem est instructu ornatuque comitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus autem verborum duplex, unus simplicium, alter collocatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 23, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33022.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a decoration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:43:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 43, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afferre ornatum orationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:134" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 39, 134</bibl></cit>.— Of <hi rend="ital">the world</hi>, corresp. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ko/smos</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tantus caeli ornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:44:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 44, 115</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 4, 3, § 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli et terra et omnis ornatus eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orneus: <entryFree id="n33023" type="main" key="orne^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ornĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ornus</etym>, <sense id="n33023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the wild mountain-ash</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:82" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33024" type="main" key="Orne_us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ornēus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/orneios</foreign>, <sense id="n33024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Centaur at the wedding of Pirithoüs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 302</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ornithias: <entryFree id="n33025" type="greek" key="orni_thi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ornīthĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rniqi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n33025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bird-wind</hi>, a wind that blows in spring and brings with it the birds of passage: <cit><quote lang="la">Favonium quidam a. d. VIII. Cal. Mart. Chelidoniam vocant, ab hirundinis visu: nonnulli vero Ornithian, uno et sexagesimo die post brumam, ab adventu avium, flantem per dies novem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. p. 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 21</bibl>.—The Etesiae are also sometimes called Ornithiae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 127</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ornithogale: <entryFree id="n33026" type="greek" key="orni_tho^ga^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ornīthŏgălē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rniqoga/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n33026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the star of Bethlehem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 62, § 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ornithon: <entryFree id="n33027" type="greek" key="orni_thon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ornīthon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rniqw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n33027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a birdhouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poultry-house</hi> (pure Lat. aviarium): <cit><quote lang="la">ornithonas dico omnium alitum, quae intra parietes villae solent pasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:4:2" default="NO">3, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orno: <entryFree id="n33028" type="main" key="orno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (old form of the <sense id="n33028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> ORNAVET, Column. Rostr.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>perh. root var-, cover; Sanscr. varna-, color</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to fit out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide with necessaries; to equip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare</hi> (class.; syn. exorno, concinno). </sense><sense id="n33028.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">age nunc, orna te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandium domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: ornatur ferro Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10</bibl> (Ann. v. 190 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decemviros apparitoribus, scribis, librariis, praeconibus, architectis, praeterea mulis, tabernaculis, centuriis, supellectili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: CLASESQVE-NAVALES-PRIMOS-ORNAVET, <hi rend="ital">fitted out</hi>, Column. Rostr.: <cit><quote lang="la">maximas classes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:20:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 20, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias omnibus rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincias,</quote> <trans><tr>to furnish money</tr>, <tr>arms</tr>, <tr>and attendants to governors setting out for their provinces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 36, 5</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">consules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <hi rend="ital">to trim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide</hi> with oil: <cit><quote lang="la">lampades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 25, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33028.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set off.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33028.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam ornare quam domum suam, maluit: quamquam, Italiā ornatā, domus ipsa mihi videtur ornatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 22, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scuta ad forum ornandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua sertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monilia collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 52</bibl></cit>.—Of dressing the hair, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33028.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to adorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decorate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set off; to commend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">praise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extol; to honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show honor to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid magnificentius augere atque ornare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiones ipsas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem suis sententiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: dicere, laudandum adulescentem, ornandum, tollendum, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 20, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem omnibus rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem maximis beneficiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem laudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egressum alicujus frequentiā suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidatum suffragio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: aliquem ornare, <hi rend="ital">to bestow honor upon</hi>, <cb n="ORO" /> <hi rend="ital">advance to honor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hederā poëtam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 25</bibl></cit>.—Ironically: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus esses,</quote> <trans><tr>would have been rewarded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ornātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n33028.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fitted out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provided with necessaries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equipped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accoutred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendidly furnished</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: instructus, praeditus): sapiens plurimis artibus instructus et ornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutis telisque parati ornatique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 21, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus ornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephantus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves paratissimae, atque omni genere armorum ornatissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 31, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecia copiis non instructa solum, sed etiam ornata,</quote> <trans><tr>not provided merely</tr>, <tr>but also splendidly furnished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio bono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33028.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">ornamented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decorated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrum floribus ornatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 38, 95</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ornatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 57</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">adorned with all good qualities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illustrious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectissimus atque ornatissimus adulescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ornatissimus loco, ordine, nomine, virtute, ingenio, copiis,</quote> <trans><tr>honored</tr>, <tr>respected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:48:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 48, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornati elaboratique versus,</quote> <trans><tr>embellished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus ad dicendum ornatissimus,</quote> <trans><tr>admirably adapted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ornātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornamentally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegantly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apte, distincte, ornate dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas agere ornatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam ornatissime et copiosissime defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:5:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 5, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ornus: <entryFree id="n33029" type="main" key="ornus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ornus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wild mountain-ash</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">steriles orni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 18, 30, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arbor. 16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arbor. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33029.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a lance</hi> made of the wood of this tree: <cit><quote lang="la">vibrabilis ornus Achilli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 24, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oro: <entryFree id="n33030" type="main" key="o_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (orassis for oraveris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 63</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. os, to speak</etym>: <sense id="n33030.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">oro ab ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=76" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 76</bibl></cit> Müll. </sense><sense id="n33030.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (so obsol.): <cit><quote lang="la">orare antiquos dixisse pro agere testimonio est, quod oratores dicti et causarum actores et qui rei publicae mandatas causas agebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=198" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 198</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum aequumque oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talibus orabat Juno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33030.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n33030.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To treat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">argue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plead</hi> (as an ambassador, advocate, etc.; class., but very rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ago): REM VBI PAGVNT ORATO, Fragm. XII. Tab.: matronis ipsis, quae raptae erant, orantibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at their mediation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam capitis,</quote> <trans><tr>to argue</tr>, <tr>plead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 12, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orandae litis tempus accommodare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si causa oranda esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:849" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 849</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo de salute suā agit, orat atque obsecrat,</quote> <trans><tr>treats</tr>, <tr>speaks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam dixit et ipse pro se oravit,</quote> <trans><tr>plead his own cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33030.4" n="2" level="3"> Of oratorical speaking, eloquence (freq. in Quint.): ars orandi, <hi rend="ital">the oratorical art</hi>, <hi rend="ital">art of oratory</hi>, Quint. prooem. § 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:15:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orandi scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orandi studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 6, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33030.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beg</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beseech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreat</hi> one (the predom. signif. in all periods and styles; syn.: rogo, obsecro, obtestor, supplico, precor); constr. usually with <hi rend="ital">acc. of the pers. and of the thing</hi>, and with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> (the less freq. constructions, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>). </sense><sense id="n33030.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. of the pers. and of the thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud te ad extremum et oro et hortor, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:16:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 16, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa deos orans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33030.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. of the pers.</hi> only: virginem orare, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 379</bibl> P: cum desubito me orat mulier, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 517, 15</bibl> (Cax. v. 9 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">socer Non orandus erat, sed vi faciendus Erechtheus,</quote> <trans><tr>not to be entreated</tr>, <tr>but compelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 701</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lydia, dic, per omnes Te deos oro, Sy barin cur properes amando perdere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33030.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. of the thing</hi> for which one asks: <cit><quote lang="la">gnato uxorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to request a wife for one's son</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati Romam missi, auxilium ad bellum orantes,</quote> <trans><tr>to ask assistance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opem rebus affectis orantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33030.9" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: rogat <cb n="OROE" /> oratque te Chrysogone, ut, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 49, 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te, C. Flave, oro et obtestor, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 42, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te etiam atque etiam oro, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc me a vobis orare Juppiter jussit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 64</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orant, ignoscamus peccatum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et vocet oro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idque sinas, oro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:1:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogat eos atque orat, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:39:section=96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 39, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod te, Aesculapi, et te, Salus, ne quid sit hujus, oro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With the <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">absiste inceptis, oro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:336" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 336</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc. of person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 143</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 319</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 61</bibl> and 905.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jampridem a me illos abducere Thestylis orat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 313</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 231</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel Aegypti praefecturam concedi sibi oraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 47</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <hi rend="ital">abl. of a person</hi>, followed by <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum hoc abs te oro, ni me inexorabilem faxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Tr. 122" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Tr. 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oravitque a suis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratus ab Artorio, ne in castris remaneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:70:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 70, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">k</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">cum aliquo</hi>: quod tecum pater orat, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=198" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 198</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 20 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">si is mecum oraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum oro et quaeso, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egi, atque oravi tecum, uxorem ut duceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 22</bibl>; cited above, II. A.—（<foreign lang="greek">l</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi> and the <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec pro civibus se orare, sed pro, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Octavius orandus sit pro salute cujusquam civis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pro illā ores, ut sit propitius (deus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33030.10" n="b" level="4"> Oro te, <hi rend="ital">I pray thee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prithee</hi>, parenthetically, a formula of politeness (cf. quaeso): <cit><quote lang="la">dic. oro te, clarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 16, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33030.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to supplicate</hi> God (eccl. Lat.); <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oravit Dominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem quam orat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3 Reg. 8, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Par. 6, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filios, id. Job, 19, 17: Deum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 50, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes longas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 23, 14</bibl></cit>.—More often <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut audias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 43, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in loco isto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3 Reg. 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra viam civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Dominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4 Reg. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lacrimis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tob. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus orans et unus maledicens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 34, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritu et mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Cor. 14, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem decalvatam orare non decet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 6, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orandi gratia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 15, 20</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an orator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 6, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oroanda: <entryFree id="n33031" type="main" key="O^ro^anda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrŏanda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Pisidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 37</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33031.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrŏandenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Oroanda</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati Oroandensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33031.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrŏandĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Oroanda</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oroandicus ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:19:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 19, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 42, § 147</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33031.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrŏ-andes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a part of the Taurus range</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orobanche: <entryFree id="n33032" type="main" key="o^ro^banche_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrŏbanchē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)roba/gxh</foreign>, <sense id="n33032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broom-rape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choke-weed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orobethron: <entryFree id="n33033" type="main" key="o^ro^be_thron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrŏbēthron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n33033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for the plant</hi> hypocisthus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 31, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orobias: <entryFree id="n33034" type="greek" key="o^ro^bi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrŏbĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)robi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n33034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of incense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in small grains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resembling the chickpea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orobinus: <entryFree id="n33035" type="greek" key="o^ro^bi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrŏbĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)ro/binos</foreign>, <sense id="n33035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resembling the chickpea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 59, § 163</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orobitis: <entryFree id="n33036" type="greek" key="o^ro^bi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrŏbītis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)robi=tis</foreign> (like the chickpea; hence, sc. chrysocolla), <sense id="n33036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">borax dyed of a yellowish color by means of the plant</hi> lutum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 27, § 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orobus: <entryFree id="n33037" type="main" key="o^ro^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrŏbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/robos</foreign>, <sense id="n33037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bitter vetch</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:19:113" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 19, 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orodes: <entryFree id="n33038" type="main" key="O^ro_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrōdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n33038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> also Orodi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 18, 1</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 2</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)orw/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a male proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33038.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of the Parthians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who took Crassus prisoner and put him to death</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:46:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 46, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:11:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 11, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33038.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Orodes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of the former</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 35</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n33038.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of the Colchians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:28" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 28</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n33038.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of the Albanians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 6, 11</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n33038.5" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a warrior slain by Mezentius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 732</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oroetes: <entryFree id="n33039" type="main" key="O^ro^etes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrŏetes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a commander of the Medes under Darius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> <pb n="1281" /> <cb n="ORTH" /></sense></entryFree>
oromedon: <entryFree id="n33040" type="main" key="O_ro^me^don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōrŏmĕdon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)wrome/dwn</foreign>, <sense id="n33040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the giants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9</bibl> (4, 8), 48.</sense></entryFree>
orontes: <entryFree id="n33041" type="main" key="O^rontes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrontes</orth>, <itype>is or ae</itype> (<sense id="n33041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Oronti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 220</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)oro/nths</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n33041.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The principal river of Syria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Nahr El-Ashy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:12:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 21, 18, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 23</bibl> (3, 17), 21.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏrontēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Orontes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Orontian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Syrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orontea myrrha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33041.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A chief of the Lycii and companion of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 113</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">220</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oropus: <entryFree id="n33042" type="main" key="O_ro_pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōrōpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)wrwpo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Attica</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Oropo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orosius: <entryFree id="n33043" type="main" key="Orosi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orosĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ecclesiastic of Tarragona</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who flourished</hi> A. D. 500; <hi rend="ital">he wrote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the advice of St. Augustine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and to confute the pagans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a history from the beginning of the world to his own times</hi>: Historiarum libri VII. adversus Paganos.</sense></entryFree>
orozelum: <entryFree id="n33044" type="main" key="oroze_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orozēlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n33044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> chamaepitys, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orphaicus: <entryFree id="n33045" type="main" key="Orpha^i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orphăĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Orpheus, C.</entryFree>
orphanotrophium: <entryFree id="n33046" type="greek" key="orpha^no_^trophi_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orphănō^trophīum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rfanotrofei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n33046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an orphan-asylum</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orphanotrophus: <entryFree id="n33047" type="greek" key="orpha^no_^tro^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orphănō^trŏphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rfanotro/fos</foreign>, <sense id="n33047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bringer-up of orphans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fosterfather of orphans</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 32</bibl>; Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:405" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 405</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orphanus: <entryFree id="n33048" type="main" key="orpha^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orphănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rfano/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an orphan</hi>, Ven. Fort. 4, 25, 11; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Serm. 24, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 9, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">67, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Johan. 14, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orphas: <entryFree id="n33049" type="spur" key="orphas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orphas</orth>, v. l. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:104" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 104</bibl> for orphus, q. v.</entryFree>
orpheus: <entryFree id="n33050" type="main" key="Orpheus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orpheus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>i</itype> (Gr. <case>dat.</case> Orphei, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 57</bibl>; Gr. <case>acc.</case> Orphĕă, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 41</bibl>: <sense id="n33050.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Orphēā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <case>voc.</case> Orpheu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 494</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 44</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)orfeu/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the famous mythic singer of Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Œagrus and Calliope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and husband of Eurydice; after her death he led her back from the Lower World</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but lost her on turning to look at her</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breaking his promise to Pluto. He was one of the Argonauts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 5</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 164" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:251" default="NO">251</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 107</bibl> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33050.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Or-phēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)orfei=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Orpheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Orphean</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:42" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33050.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Or-phĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)orfiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Orpheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Orphic</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra Orphica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 23, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 18, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33050.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Orphăĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)orfaiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Orphic.</hi>—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Orphăĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Orphics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the followers of Orpheus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orphne: <entryFree id="n33051" type="hapax" key="Orphne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orphnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Orphne</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/orfnh</foreign> (Darkness), <hi rend="ital">a nymph</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 539</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orphus: <entryFree id="n33052" type="greek" key="orphus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rfo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the gilt-head</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 54, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:104" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orrhopygium: <entryFree id="n33053" type="spur" key="orrho^py_gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orrhŏpȳgĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, a false read. for orthopygium, q. v.</entryFree>
orsa: <entryFree id="n33054" type="main" key="orsa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orsa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ordior</etym>. <sense id="n33054.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Beginnings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commencements</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an undertaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attempt</hi>: ut (di) orsis tanti operis successus prosperos darent, Liv. praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orsa juvare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:21" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33054.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speech</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sic orsa vicissim Ore refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 435</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 632</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:472" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 472</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Menandri, i. e. carmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 4, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orses: <entryFree id="n33055" type="main" key="Orses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orses</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Trojan warrior</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 748</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orsiloche: <entryFree id="n33056" type="main" key="Orsi^lo^che_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orsĭlŏchē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of the Tauric Diana</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orsilochus: <entryFree id="n33057" type="main" key="Orsi^lo^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orsĭlŏchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Trojan warrior</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 636</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orsinus: <entryFree id="n33058" type="main" key="orsinus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orsinus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n33058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of crocus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 39, § 67</bibl>.—Perh. an error in the MSS. for orinus, or oreinos; cf. Jan. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
orsorius: <entryFree id="n33059" type="main" key="orso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ordior</etym>, <sense id="n33059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to a loom</hi>: in palo orsorio, S. S. Judic. 16, 13; id. ap. Auct. de Promiss, et Praedict. Dei, 2, 22, 45 (where the Vulg. reads alia omnia).</sense></entryFree>
orsus: <entryFree id="n33060" type="main" key="orsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. ordior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33061" type="main" key="orsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <etym>ordior</etym>, <sense id="n33061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commencement; an undertaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attempt</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pectoris, Cic. poët. Div. 2, 30, 63: tenuis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orthagoriscus: <entryFree id="n33062" type="main" key="ortha^go^riscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthăgŏriscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqagori/skos</foreign>, <cb n="ORTU" /> <sense id="n33062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pig-fish</hi>, so called from the noise it was said to make when taken, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 9, § 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orthampelos: <entryFree id="n33063" type="greek" key="orthampe^los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthampĕlos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqa/mpelos</foreign>, <sense id="n33063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a straight vine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vine that grows upright</hi>, and needs no support, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orthembasis: <entryFree id="n33064" type="greek" key="orthemba^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthembăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqos-e)/mbasis</foreign>, <sense id="n33064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a straight step</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orthius: <entryFree id="n33065" type="greek" key="orthi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/rqios</foreign>, <sense id="n33065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi> (post-class.): carmen quod orthium dicitur (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">no/mos o)/rqios</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:19:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 19, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orthius (pes), qui ex tetrasemi elatione, id est arsi, et octasemi positione constabit: ita ut duodecim tempora hic pes recepisse videatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 985</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orthocissos: <entryFree id="n33066" type="greek" key="ortho^cissos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthŏcissos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqo/kissos</foreign>, <sense id="n33066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of tall ivy</hi> (opp. to the chamaecissos), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:30" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orthocolus: <entryFree id="n33067" type="greek" key="ortho^co_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthŏcōlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqo/kwlos</foreign>, <sense id="n33067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stiff in the joints</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orthodoxus: <entryFree id="n33068" type="greek" key="ortho^doxus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthŏdoxus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqo/docos</foreign>, <sense id="n33068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">orthodox</hi> (post-class.): viri, Auct. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecclesia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">orthŏdoxē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, Rustic. c. Aceph. p. 1219.</sense></entryFree>
orthogonius: <entryFree id="n33069" type="greek" key="ortho^go_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthŏgōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqogw/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n33069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">right-angled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rectangular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orthogonal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trigonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 11</bibl></cit>: ossicla, Aus. praef. ad Idyll. 13.</sense></entryFree>
orthographia: <entryFree id="n33070" type="greek" key="ortho_^gra^phi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthō^grăphĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqografi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n33070.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Orthography</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">orthographia, id est formula ratioque scribendi a grammaticis instituta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:88" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:11" default="NO">1, 7, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33070.1" n="II" level="1"> In architecture, <hi rend="ital">an elevation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">front view</hi> of a building, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orthographus: <entryFree id="n33071" type="greek" key="ortho_^gra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthō^grăphus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqo/grafos</foreign>, <sense id="n33071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">orthographic</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">veritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33071.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">orthō^-grăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqogra/fos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an orthographer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Orthogr. p. 2320</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
orthomastius: <entryFree id="n33072" type="main" key="ortho^masti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthŏmastĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (= <foreign lang="greek">o)rqoma/stios</foreign>, from <foreign lang="greek">o)rqo/s, masto/s</foreign>), <sense id="n33072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">high-breasted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mammarum effigie orthomastia mala,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of large apple</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
orthophallicus: <entryFree id="n33073" type="greek" key="orthophalli^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthophallĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqo/s-fallo/s</foreign>, i. e. <sense id="n33073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">obscene</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 101, 3</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
orthopnoea: <entryFree id="n33074" type="greek" key="orthopnoea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthopnoea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqo/pnoia</foreign>, <sense id="n33074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">difficulty of breathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">asthma</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orthopny</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 4, 14, § 37</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 20, 83, § 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orthopnoicus: <entryFree id="n33075" type="greek" key="orthopno^i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthopnŏĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqopnoi+ko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">asthmatic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 73, § 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:145" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 16, 92, § 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orthopsalticus: <entryFree id="n33076" type="greek" key="orthopsalti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthopsaltĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqoyaltiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full playing</hi>: psalterium, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 101, 1</bibl>; cf. Oehler ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Menipp. p. 179" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Menipp. p. 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orthopygium: <entryFree id="n33077" type="greek" key="ortho^py_gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthŏpȳgĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqopu/gion</foreign>, <sense id="n33077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the rump and tail feathers of birds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 12</bibl> (al. orrhopygium = <foreign lang="greek">o)rropu/gion</foreign>, of the same meaning).</sense></entryFree>
orthosia: <entryFree id="n33078" type="greek" key="Ortho_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orthōsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)orqwsi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n33078.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Phœnicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 20, 17, § 78</bibl>.—By <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 856</bibl>, called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Orthōsis</orth>, ĭdis. —</sense><sense id="n33078.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Caria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Mœander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orthostata:
<entryFree id="n33079" type="greek" key="orthosta^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">orthostăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqosta/ths</foreign> (that stands upright), in archit., <sense id="n33079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the facing of a wall</hi> (pure Lat. frons), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 19</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>
(† <orth extent="full" lang="la">orthrăgŏriscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rqragori/skos</foreign>, v. l. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 9, § 19</bibl>, for orthagoriscus, q. v.)</sense></entryFree>
orthrus: <entryFree id="n33080" type="main" key="Orthrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Orthrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/orqros</foreign>. <sense id="n33080.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Geryon's dog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:845" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 845</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33080.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Gud.</author> 269, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ortivus: <entryFree id="n33081" type="main" key="orti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ortīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. ortus</etym>, <sense id="n33081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to rising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rising</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 141, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cardo,</quote> <trans><tr>the eastern quarter of the heavens</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 188</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ortona: <entryFree id="n33082" type="main" key="Orto_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ortōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital city and port of the Frentani in Latium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ortona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 106</bibl> (Jan. Hortona).</sense></entryFree>
ortospanum: <entryFree id="n33083" type="main" key="Ortospanum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ortospanum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Hor-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Orto-pana</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n33083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient city of Bactriana;</hi> form Ortospanum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 61</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form Ortopana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
