ortus: <entryFree id="n33084" type="main" key="ortus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from orior, q. v. <sense id="n33084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33085" type="main" key="ortus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ortus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>orior</etym>. <sense id="n33085.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rising</hi> of the heavenly bodies (opp. occasus; class.): solis et lunae reliquorumque siderum ortus, obitus motusque cognoscere, <cb n="OS" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:56:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 56, 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primi sub lumina solis et ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sol) ab ortu ad occasum commeans,</quote> <trans><tr>from east to west</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: solis, <hi rend="ital">sunrise</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the orient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the east</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum bis ad occasum, bis se convertit ad ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitido ab ortu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortus lucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:16:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 16, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33085.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">origin</hi> (cf. origo): <cit><quote lang="la">tribuniciae potestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Favonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 8, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materno ortu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Elide ducimus ortum,</quote> <trans><tr>we are sprung</tr>, <tr>derive our origin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:494" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortus nascentium,</quote> <trans><tr>the birth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 43, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:38:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 38, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato ortu Tusculanus,</quote> <trans><tr>by birth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—Of a river, <hi rend="ital">the source</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec venias ad fluminis ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 139</bibl></cit>.—Of plants, <hi rend="ital">the springing up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 211</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ortygia: <entryFree id="n33086" type="main" key="orty^gi^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ortygĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ortyga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">o)/rtuc</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n33086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 53" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33087" type="main" key="Orty^gi^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ortygĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ortygĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ortugi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n33087.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another name for the isle of Delos</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 337</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=183" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 183</bibl> Müll.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Orty-gĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Ortygian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Diana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 694</bibl></cit>: boves, <hi rend="ital">of Apollo</hi>, bred in Delos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:692" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 692</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33087.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island which forms a part of the city of Syracuse</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Siracusa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 694</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 499</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:471" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 471</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ortygometra: <entryFree id="n33088" type="greek" key="orty^go^me_tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ortygŏmētra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)rtugomh/tra</foreign>, <sense id="n33088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quail-mother</hi>, a bird that leads the quails in their migrations across the sea, <hi rend="ital">the landrail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortygometrā duce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 33, § 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33088.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a quail</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Psych. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ortyx: <entryFree id="n33089" type="greek" key="ortyx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ortyx</orth>, <itype>ygis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/rtuc</foreign>, <sense id="n33089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 61, § 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
orum: <entryFree id="n33090" type="main" key="o_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. aurum <sense id="n33090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
oryx: <entryFree id="n33091" type="greek" key="o^ryx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏryx</orth>, <itype>ygis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/ruc</foreign>, <sense id="n33091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wild goat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gazelle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaetulus oryx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:140" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:94:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 94, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 14, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 40, 40, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oryza: <entryFree id="n33092" type="greek" key="o^ry_za"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏrȳza</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ŏrīza</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/pnza</foreign>, <sense id="n33092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 155</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 13, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
os: <entryFree id="n33093" type="main" key="o_s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōs</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype> (no <sense id="n33093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindr. with Sanscr. āsya, os, vultus, facies</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the mouth</hi> (syn. bucca): quam tibi ex ore orationem duriter dictis dedit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 512, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ore in ejus os inflato aquam dato palumbo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec omnia percipienda os est aptissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:184" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris hiatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os tenerum pueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trilingue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os loquentis Opprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 296</bibl></cit>: in ore omnium esse, <hi rend="ital">to be in everybody's mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be the common talk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ore est omni populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius nequitiam in ore vulgi atque in communibus proverbiis esse versatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:46:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 46, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Harmodius in ore est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ore omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:23:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 23, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere aliquid in ore,</quote> <trans><tr>to have a thing in one's mouth</tr>, <tr>be constantly talking of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 22, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscebatur ore vulgi dux Agricola,</quote> <trans><tr>with one voice</tr>, <tr>one consent</tr>, <tr>unanimously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 41</bibl></cit>.—So, uno ore, <hi rend="ital">unanimously</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 81:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 81, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno omnes eadem ore fremebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 132</bibl></cit>: volito vivus per ora virūm, <hi rend="ital">soon become famous</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 34</bibl> (Epigr. v. 4 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">virūm volitare per ora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> G 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ora vulgi, or hominum pervenire, or abire,</quote> <trans><tr>to get into people's mouths</tr>, <tr>become the common talk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 40, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire per ora Nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:135" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic Graecā doctrinā ore tenus exercitus animum bonis artibus non induerat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>only as far as his tongue</tr>, <tr>only so as to talk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 45</bibl></cit>.—Hence, os suum aperire (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">to begin to speak</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 33, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 51, 33</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">os alicujus aperire,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause to speak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:33:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 33, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 27</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 27.—But: aperuerunt super me os suum, sicut leo,</quote> <trans><tr>threatened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 21, 13</bibl></cit>: os sublinere alicui, <hi rend="ital">to cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">befool</hi>, v. sublino.—</sense><sense id="n33093.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp.: pleno ore, i. e. <hi rend="ital">heartily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">zealously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea nescio quomodo quasi pleniore ore laudamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33093.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33093.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <hi rend="ital">the face</hi>, <hi rend="ital">countenance</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus, facies), acutis oculis, ore rubicundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figura oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: iratorum,<pb n="1282" /> <cb n="OS" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ore sunt omhia, in eo autem ipso dominatus est omnis oculorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>every thing depends on the countenance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tuo ore vultuque acquiesco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concedas hinc aliquo ab ore eorum aliquantisper,</quote> <trans><tr>come out from them</tr>, <tr>out from their presence</tr>, <tr>leave them alone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>. —So of lower animals: <cit><quote lang="la">insignis et ore Et rutilis clarus squamis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ore rubicundo (gallina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 56, 77, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales cristati cantibus oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coram in os aliquem laudare,</quote> <trans><tr>to praise one to his face</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui laedere os,</quote> <trans><tr>to insult one to his face</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere os,</quote> <trans><tr>to expose one's self to personal insults</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">os praebere ad contumeliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ore parentum liberos jugulat,</quote> <trans><tr>before their parents' eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:19:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 19, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in ore atque in oculis provinciae gesta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:33:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 33, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ore omnium cotidie versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut esset posteris ante os documentum Persarum sceleris sempiternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illos aiunt epulis ante ora positis excruciari fame,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante ora conjugum omnia pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 19, 12</bibl></cit>.—So of the <hi rend="ital">face</hi>, <hi rend="ital">front</hi>, as indicative of modesty or impudence: os habet, linguam, perfidiam, = Engl. <hi rend="ital">cheek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">os durum!</quote> <trans><tr>you brazen face!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os durissimum,</quote> <trans><tr>very bold</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 24, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impudens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo redibo ore ad eam, quam contempserim?</quote> <trans><tr>with what face?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 32</bibl>.—Hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">boldness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effrontery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tandem os est illius patroni, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostis os hominis, nostis audaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:20:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 20, § 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non, si Appii os haberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 10</bibl></cit>, a, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 8, 1</bibl>.—On the contrary: os molle, <hi rend="ital">modest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bashful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil erat mollius ore Pompeii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33093.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The head</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gorgonis os pulcherrimum, cinctum anguibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:56:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 56, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncis arborum antefixa ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 61</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33093.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Speech</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ora sono discordia signant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 423</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33093.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entrance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aperture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orifice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">os lenonis aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta velut in ore urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentem lato dedit ore fenestram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ponti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:58:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 58, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os atque aditus portus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">30: specūs,</quote> <trans><tr>entrance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vascula oris angusti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>.— Also of the <hi rend="ital">sources</hi> of a stream: <cit><quote lang="la">fontem superare Timavi, Unde per ora novem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 245</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33093.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The beak</hi> of a ship: <cit><quote lang="la">ora navium Rostrata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:17" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33093.8" n="F" level="1"> Os leonis, <hi rend="ital">lion's-mouth</hi>, a plant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:98" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33093.9" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The edge</hi> of a sword: <cit><quote lang="la">interfecit in ore gladii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 15, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4 Reg. 10, 25</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33094" type="main" key="o^s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏs</orth>, <itype>ossis</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ossum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 112</bibl> P.; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 750</bibl> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. adv. Marc. 2, 196</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ossu</orth>, <itype>u</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 12</bibl> P.—In <number>plur.</number>: <sense id="n33094.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">OSSVA for OSSA, freq. in inscrr.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2906</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4361</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4806</bibl>; Inscr. Osann. Syll. p. 497, 1; Cardin. Dipl. Imp. 2, 11: ossuum for ossium, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 111), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prop. ossis for ostis, kindred with Sanscr. asthi, os; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)ste/on</foreign>; Slav. kostj</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a bone</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n33094.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dicam de ossibus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur hunc dolorem cineri ejus atque ossibus inussisti? (i. e. mortuo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:44:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 44, § 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 49</bibl>, § 128: ossa legere, <hi rend="ital">to gather up the bones</hi> that remain after burning a corpse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:33:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 33, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">condere,</quote> <trans><tr>to bury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 47</bibl></cit>: ossa legere, <hi rend="ital">to extract fragments of bone</hi> from a wound, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:24:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Prov. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 30</bibl>: tum vero exarsit juveni dolor ossibus ingens, <hi rend="ital">in his bones</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in his inmost part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in his soul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 172</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui versat in ossibus Durus amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 258</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 55</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 4, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33094.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the hard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">innermost part</hi> of trees or fruits: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum ossa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the inside wood</tr>, <tr>the heart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 43, § 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olearum ac palmularum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the stones</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33094.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the bones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the solid parts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">outlines</hi> of a discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam imitarentur (Atticos dicendo), nec ossa solum, sed etiam sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 17, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1, p. 34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, p. 34</bibl>. <cb n="OSCI" /></sense></entryFree>
osca: <entryFree id="n33095" type="main" key="Osca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Osca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Hispania Tarraconensis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Huesca</hi>, in Aragon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:30:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 30, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:22:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 22, 9</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oscensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Osca</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a town of Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Oscan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <trans><tr>with the Oscan stamp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 10</bibl></cit>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oscenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Osca</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Oscans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
osce: <entryFree id="n33096" type="main" key="Osce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oscē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Osci <sense id="n33096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
oscedo: <entryFree id="n33097" type="main" key="osce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with oscito</etym>. <sense id="n33097.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An inclination to yawn</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33097.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sore in the mouth of children</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aphthœ</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 14, 216</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 4, 8, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oscen: <entryFree id="n33098" type="main" key="oscen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (but <gen>f.</gen> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:7:67" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 7, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 19, 22, § 43</bibl>) [obscen, from obs-cano], <sense id="n33098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a singing-bird</hi>, esp. in the auspices; <hi rend="ital">a divining-bird</hi>, from whose notes auguries were taken (e. g. the raven, crow, owl): aves aut oscines sunt, aut praepetes: oscines, quae ore futura praedicunt; <cit><quote lang="la">praepetes, quae volatu augurium significant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 361</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscinem corvum prece suscitabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 19, 22, § 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Soc. p. 45, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebeius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the crow metamorphosed by Phœbus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oscensis: <entryFree id="n33099" type="main" key="Oscensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oscensis</orth>, v. Osca.</entryFree>
osci: <entryFree id="n33100" type="main" key="Osci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Osci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Oscans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a primitive people of Campania; in more ancient times called also</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Opici</orth> <hi rend="ital">and</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Opsci</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Obsci</orth>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:730" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 730</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=198" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 198</bibl> Müll. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n33100.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Oscan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 28</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:730" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 730</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 20, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludicrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oscē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in Oscan</hi>: qui Osce et Volsce fabulantur: nam Latine nesciunt, Titin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=198" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 198</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=131" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 131</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:17:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oscillans: <entryFree id="n33101" type="gloss" key="oscillans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscillans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <sense id="n33101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, v. oscillo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
oscillatio: <entryFree id="n33102" type="main" key="oscilla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscillātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>oscillo</etym>, <sense id="n33102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swinging</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 140, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies festus oscillationis,</quote> <trans><tr>a festival celebrated at Athens in honor of Erigone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 130" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 130</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oscillo: <entryFree id="n33103" type="gloss" key="oscillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscillo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>2. oscillum</etym>, <sense id="n33103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swing one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscillum Santra dici ait, quod oscillent, id est inclinent, praecipitesque in os ferantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=194:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 194, 9</bibl></cit> and 10 Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: osculor, Mythogr. Lat. 1, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">oscillans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a swinger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscillantes, ait Cornificius, ab eo, quod os celare soliti personis propter verecundiam, qui eo genere lusūs utebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=194" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 194</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
oscillum: <entryFree id="n33104" type="main" key="oscillum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. os; lit. little mouth; hence</etym>, <sense id="n33104.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little cavity in the middle of leguminous fruits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where the germ sprouts forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscilla lupinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n33104.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little image of the face</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little mask of Bacchus</hi>, hung from trees, so as to be easily moved by the wind: <cit><quote lang="la">tibique (Bacche) Oscilla ex altā suspendunt mollia pinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 389</bibl></cit>; cf. Serv. ad loc.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33105" type="main" key="oscillum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ob- or obs-cillo</etym>, <sense id="n33105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=194" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 194</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 389</bibl> (v. Serv. ad loc.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
oscines: <entryFree id="n33106" type="main" key="osci^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscĭnes</orth>, v. oscen.</entryFree>
oscitabundus: <entryFree id="n33107" type="main" key="osci^ta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscĭtābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>oscito</etym>, <sense id="n33107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gaping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yawning</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oscitans: <entryFree id="n33108" type="main" key="osci^tans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscĭtans</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from oscito.</entryFree>
oscitanter: <entryFree id="n33109" type="main" key="osci^tanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscĭtanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. oscito, <sense id="n33109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
oscitatio: <entryFree id="n33110" type="main" key="osci^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>oscito</etym>, <sense id="n33110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an opening of the mouth wide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gaping.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33110.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">conchas pandentes sese quādam oscitatione,</quote> <trans><tr>a gaping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33110.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a gaping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yawning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 6, 5, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:6:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 6, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33110.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed Bruti senis oscitationes,</quote> <trans><tr>tediousnesses</tr>, <tr>tedious writings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:20" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ipse (judex) nostrā oscitatione solvatur,</quote> <trans><tr>by our languid speaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oscito: <entryFree id="n33111" type="main" key="osci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">oscĭtor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (<sense id="n33111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> oscitarier, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 322, 18</bibl>; or Com. Rel. v. 15 Rib.) [oscieo], <hi rend="ital">to open the mouth wide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gape.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33111.1" n="I" level="1"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">to open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unclose</hi>: oscitat in campis caput a cervice revulsum, of the plant lion's-mouth, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 10, 396</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:260" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 260</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">(arborum) folia cotidie ad solem oscitant,</quote> <trans><tr>turn towards the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 24, 36, § 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33111.2" n="II" level="1"> Of living beings, <hi rend="ital">to gape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yawn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pandiculans oscitatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 80</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1065" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1065</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clare ac sonore oscitavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 8</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="OSIR" /> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid adhuc oscitamus crapulam hesternam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Ver. Rel. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33111.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be listless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drowsy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dormio. sterto): cum majores (calamitates) impendere videantur, sedetis et oscitamini,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>are listless</tr>, <tr>idle</tr>, <tr>negligent</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 36, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">oscĭtans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">listless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lazy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligent</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">interea oscitantes opprimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: quae Epicurus oscitans allucinatus est, qs. <hi rend="ital">half asleep</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 72</bibl>.—Of abstract things: <cit><quote lang="la">oscitans et dormitans sapientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 144</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">oscĭtanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">carelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ille tam solute egisset, tam leniter, tam oscitanter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:80:277" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 80, 277</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
osculabundus: <entryFree id="n33112" type="main" key="oscu^la_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscŭlābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>osculor</etym>, <sense id="n33112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">kissing</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum sacerdotis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, 6, p. 259</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. 94, p. 333</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
osculana: <entryFree id="n33113" type="gloss" key="Oscu^la_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oscŭlāna</orth> <itype>pugna in proverbio, quo significabatur, victos vincere, quia in eādem et Valerius Laevinus imperator Romanus a Pyrrho erat victus</itype>, et brevi eundem regem devicerat Sulpicius ..., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=197" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 197</bibl> Müll. (leg. Asculana; cf. Turneb. Advers. 3, 11).</entryFree>
osculatio: <entryFree id="n33114" type="main" key="oscu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>osculor</etym>, <sense id="n33114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kissing</hi> (rare but class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 20, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 48, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33114.1" n="II" level="1"> In med. lang.: venarum, <hi rend="ital">the inosculation of blood-vessels</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a\nasto/mwsis</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:10:121" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 10, 121</bibl> and 123.</sense></entryFree>
osculo: <entryFree id="n33115" type="main" key="oscu^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. os, ōris</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nastomo/w</foreign>, <sense id="n33115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to supply with a mouth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">outlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi> a channel, e. g. the veins, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:10:123" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 10, 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33116" type="main" key="oscu^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (old collat. form of osculor), <sense id="n33116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to kiss</hi>: osculavi caput, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 476, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">osculato tuo capite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 117, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genua sibi osculari patiebantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. Juv. 2, § 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
osculor: <entryFree id="n33117" type="main" key="oscu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">auscŭ-lor</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 14</bibl>; old <sense id="n33117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> oscularier; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>osculum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to kiss</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n33117.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: compellando blanditer, ausculando. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam vidisse cum alieno oscularier,</quote> <trans><tr>kissing each other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">osculari atque amplexari inter se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille autem me complexus atque osculans flere prohibebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:14:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum complexus, osculatusque dimisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">osculetur me osculo oris sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 1, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33117.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make much of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prize</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicum meum sic amplexabantur, sic osculabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientiam juris tamquam filiolam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 10, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
osculum: <entryFree id="n33118" type="main" key="oscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oscŭlum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">auscŭlum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 84</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">osclum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 8</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. os</etym>, <sense id="n33118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretty mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweet mouth</hi> (cf.: labium, labellum). </sense><sense id="n33118.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">videt oscula, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 499</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 344</bibl>: delibare, <hi rend="ital">to touch</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to kiss</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 434</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 523</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:92:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 92, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 137, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33118.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kiss</hi> (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: basium, suavium): utinam continuo ad osculum Atticae possim currere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oggerere,</quote> <trans><tr>to give</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Cic. Fragm. ap. Non.: capere,</quote> <trans><tr>to take</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> 11, 13, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figere,</quote> <trans><tr>to imprint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eripere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:91" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere et dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detorquere ad oscula Cervicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapere,</quote> <trans><tr>to snatch</tr>, <tr>steal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:264" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">breve,</quote> <trans><tr>a brief</tr>, <tr>hasty kiss</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 4</bibl></cit>: osculi jus, <hi rend="ital">the right of kissing</hi> between relatives of both sexes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in osculo sancto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom, 16, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oscus: <entryFree id="n33119" type="main" key="Oscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Osci.</entryFree>
osdroena: <entryFree id="n33120" type="main" key="Osdro^e_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Osdrŏēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)osdrohnh/</foreign>, <sense id="n33120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country in the western part of Mesopotamia</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Diar Mochar</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 8, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Its inhabitants</hi> are called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Osdrŏēni</orth>, ōrum. <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
osi: <entryFree id="n33121" type="main" key="Osi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Osi</orth>, ōrum. <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Germany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the banks of the Danube</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
osinius: <entryFree id="n33122" type="main" key="Osi_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Osīnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">king of Clusium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and ally of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 655</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
osireostaphe: <entryFree id="n33123" type="main" key="O^si_re^osta^phe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏsīrĕostăphē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/osiris-tafh/</foreign> (Osiris-grave), <sense id="n33123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> Osiritis, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
osiris: <entryFree id="n33124" type="main" key="O^si_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏsīris</orth>, <itype>is and ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/osiris</foreign>. <sense id="n33124.0" n="I" level="1"> <pb n="1283" /> <cb n="OSTE" /> <hi rend="ital">An Egyptian deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the husband of Isis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:27" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:29" default="NO">29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:43" default="NO">43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 692</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:29" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33124.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Name of a warrior slain by Thymbrœus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 458</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
osiritis: <entryFree id="n33125" type="main" key="O^si_ri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏsīrītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> Osireostaphe or cynocephalea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 2, 6, § 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
osor: <entryFree id="n33126" type="main" key="o_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōsor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ossor</orth>, Plaut. l. l. infra), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>odi</etym>, <sense id="n33126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hater</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">uxoris suae ossor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit> Fleck. (Ussing, osor): <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 48, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Pan. Th. 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: osorem dixerunt, qui aliquem odisset, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=196" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 196</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
osphagus: <entryFree id="n33127" type="main" key="Ospha^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Osphăgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ospicor: <entryFree id="n33128" type="main" key="ospi^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ospĭcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, an old orthogr. for <orth extent="full" lang="la">aus-pĭcor</orth>, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 378</bibl> P.</entryFree>
ospratura: <entryFree id="n33129" type="greek" key="ospra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">osprātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/sprion</foreign>, <sense id="n33129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the purchase of pulse</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18:section=19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 18, § 19</bibl> dub. (al. hospitatura).</sense></entryFree>
ossa: <entryFree id="n33130" type="main" key="Ossa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ossa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 155</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ossa</foreign>, <sense id="n33130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a high mountain in Thessaly</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kissovo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter sunt conati imponere Pelio Ossam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ossan,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:307" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 307</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ossaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Ossean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">media,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:82" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ossaei bimembres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Centaurs who dwell about Ossa</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 554</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ossarium: <entryFree id="n33131" type="main" key="ossa_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ossārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. ossuarius, II.</entryFree>
osseus: <entryFree id="n33132" type="main" key="osse^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ossĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. os</etym>, <sense id="n33132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of bone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bone-</hi> (post Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cuneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33132.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Like bone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard as bone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bony</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 38, 73, § 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 10, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ossicularis: <entryFree id="n33133" type="main" key="ossi^cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ossĭcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ossiculum</etym>, <sense id="n33133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the small bones</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ossiculatim: <entryFree id="n33134" type="main" key="ossi^cu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ossĭcŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by bones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bone by bone</hi> (ante-class.): legere aliquem, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 147, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ossiculum: <entryFree id="n33135" type="main" key="ossi^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ossĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. os</etym>, <sense id="n33135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ossicle</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 49, § 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:1:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">MEA (al. OSSVCVLA),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 420</bibl></cit>, n. 381.</sense></entryFree>
ossifragus: <entryFree id="n33136" type="main" key="ossi^fra^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ossĭfrăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. os-frango</etym>, <sense id="n33136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bone-breaking</hi>, Cass. Sev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33136.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ossĭfrăgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ossĭfrăga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the sea-eagle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">osprey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 7, 8, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:63" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 7, 20, § 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipitres, atque ossifragae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1079" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1079</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 7, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ossilago: <entryFree id="n33137" type="main" key="ossi^la_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ossĭlāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. os</etym>, <sense id="n33137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hardness as of bone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bony hardness</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tumor ossilagini similis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33137.1" n="II" level="1"> = Ossipaga, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ossilegium: <entryFree id="n33138" type="gloss" key="ossi^le^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ossĭlĕgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. os-lego</etym>, <sense id="n33138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bonegathering</hi>: ossilegium, <foreign lang="greek">o)stolo/gion</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
ossilegus: <entryFree id="n33139" type="gloss" key="ossi^le^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ossĭlĕgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ossilegium</etym>, <sense id="n33139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bone-gatherer</hi>: ossilegus, <foreign lang="greek">o)stolo/gos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
ossipaga: <entryFree id="n33140" type="main" key="Ossi^pa_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ossĭpāga</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ossĭpanga, Ossĭpā-gĭna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. os-pango</etym>, <sense id="n33140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bone-fastener</hi>, the goddess who caused the bones of children to become firm and solid, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 1131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ossosus: <entryFree id="n33141" type="main" key="osso_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ossōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. os</etym>, <sense id="n33141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bony</hi> (late Lat.), Cael. Aur. Salut. praecc. 36.</sense></entryFree>
ossuarium: <entryFree id="n33142" type="main" key="ossu^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ossŭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. ossuarius, II.</entryFree>
ossuarius: <entryFree id="n33143" type="main" key="ossu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ossŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. os</etym>, <sense id="n33143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for bones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bone-</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">OLLA OSSVARIA,</quote> <trans><tr>a vase to contain the bones of a corpse</tr>, <tr>a bone-urn</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2896</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33143.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ossŭārĭum</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">ossārĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a receptacle for the bones of the dead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bone-vault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charnel-house</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:12:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4511</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4556</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ossuculum: <entryFree id="n33144" type="main" key="ossu^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ossŭcŭlum</orth>, v. ossiculum.</entryFree>
ossum: <entryFree id="n33145" type="main" key="ossum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ossum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 2. os.</entryFree>
ossuosus: <entryFree id="n33146" type="main" key="ossu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ossŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. os</etym>, <sense id="n33146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of bones</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostendo: <entryFree id="n33147" type="main" key="ostendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostendo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, and tum</itype> (ostensus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 892</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 192</bibl>: ostentus, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 45</bibl>; Pac. and Varr. ap. Prisc. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 78</bibl>: <sense id="n33147.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">ostensurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 13</bibl></cit>; App. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 892</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">ostenturus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Or. 52, 2</bibl></cit>; v. also the apoc. form: ostende ostendam, ut permultis aliis exemplis ejus generis manifestum est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=201" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 201</bibl> Müll.; perh. used by Cato, v. Müll. ad loc., and cf. the letter E), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>obs-tendo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to stretch out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spread before</hi> one; hence, <hi rend="ital">to expose to view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to show</hi>, <cb n="OSTE" /> <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi> (syn.: monstro, exhibeo). </sense><sense id="n33147.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33147.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n33147.3" n="1" level="3"> Ostendo manus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">os suum populo Romano ostendere audet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:669" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 669</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <trans><tr>to show one's self</tr>, <tr>appear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <trans><tr>to display</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites sese ostendunt,</quote> <trans><tr>show themselves</tr>, <tr>appear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 63</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33147.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <trans><tr>to make heard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 13, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33147.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to lay open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expose</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Aquiloni glaebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucos Phoebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:90" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager qui soli ostentus erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33147.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33147.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>: ille dies cum gloriā maximā sese nobis ostendat, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 880</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 384 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">non ego illi extemplo ita meum ostendam sensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum hoc facto sese ostendit,</quote> <trans><tr>he has exposed himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem, metum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to promise</tr>, <tr>threaten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:34:section=75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 34, § 75</bibl></cit> et saep.—With two <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem nocentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. Tit. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:27:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 27, 5</bibl>.—Mid., <hi rend="ital">to show itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi cum major spes ostenderetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33147.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n33147.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">express</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indicate</hi> by speech or signs; <hi rend="ital">to give to understand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make known</hi>, etc. (syn.: indico, declaro, significo).—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud ostendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">obj.</hi>- or <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostendit se cum rege colloqui velle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sui consilii sit, ostendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 3</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ostendimus supra,</quote> <trans><tr>as we showed above</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed aliter, atque ostenderam, facio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum est per quod ostenditur idonea perficiendi facultas esse quaesita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ostendendum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33147.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hold up conspicuously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flourish</hi> (ironically): <cit><quote lang="la">sed quaedam mihi magnifica et praeclara ejus defensio ostenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">osten-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n33147.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Exposed</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ager soli ostentus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:25" default="NO">1, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33147.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ostentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n33147.13" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a prodigy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wonder</hi>, that announces something about to happen, <hi rend="ital">a portent</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: monstrum, portentum): praedictiones vero et praesensiones rerum futurarum quid aliud declarant, nisi hominibus ea, quae futura sunt, ostendi, monstrari, portendi, praedici? ex quo illa ostenta, monstra, portenta, prodigia dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 42, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33147.14" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a wondrous thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigy</hi>: scis Appium ostenta facere, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 14, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostenti prorsus genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 10, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostensio: <entryFree id="n33148" type="main" key="ostensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ostendo</etym>, <sense id="n33148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a showing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibiting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifestation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nova ostensio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 133, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv.
