Marc. 5, 11</bibl>: HOMINVM ARMIGERORVM, <hi rend="ital">a mustering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parade</hi>, Inscr. Salm. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in me est iniquitas haec, da ostensionem,</quote> <trans><tr>expose</tr>, <tr>make manifest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secretorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dan. 5, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostensionalis: <entryFree id="n33149" type="main" key="ostensi^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostensĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ostensio</etym>, <sense id="n33149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves for parade</hi> or <hi rend="ital">display</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostensor: <entryFree id="n33150" type="main" key="ostensor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostensor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ostendo</etym>, <sense id="n33150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibiter</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ostensus: <entryFree id="n33151" type="main" key="ostensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from ostendo.</entryFree>
ostentabilis: <entryFree id="n33152" type="gloss" key="ostenta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostentābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ostento</etym>, <sense id="n33152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worth showing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worth seeing</hi>: ostentabilis, <foreign lang="greek">e)pideiktiko/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
ostentaculum: <entryFree id="n33153" type="gloss" key="ostenta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostentācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, for ostentum, <sense id="n33153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indication</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentat, ostentaculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostentamen: <entryFree id="n33154" type="main" key="ostenta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostentāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 203</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ostentarius: <entryFree id="n33155" type="main" key="ostenta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ostentum</etym>, <sense id="n33155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to prophetic indications</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetic</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ostentaria novitas (al. ostentatoria),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 151</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33155.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ostentārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a book of prognostics</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tuscum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostentaticius: <entryFree id="n33156" type="main" key="ostenta_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostentātīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ostento</etym>, <sense id="n33156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves for display</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ostentatious</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">virginitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostentatio: <entryFree id="n33157" type="main" key="ostenta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n33157.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <cb n="OSTE" /> <hi rend="ital">a showing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi> (very rare). in armorum magis quam togarum ostentatione, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognomen Imperiosi ... ab ostentatione saevitiae ascitum,</quote> <trans><tr>from an open display</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33157.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n33157.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An idle show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vain display</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pomp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ostentation</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word): <cit><quote lang="la">vitanda etiam ingenii ostentationis suspicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:82:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 82, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnifica et gloriosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:1:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inanis et simulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et venditatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: multorum annorum ostentationes meas nunc in discrimen esse adductas, <hi rend="ital">that my many years' boastful promises</hi> (of an able administration) <hi rend="ital">are now brought to the test</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 13, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33157.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A false</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceitful show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deception</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul veritate, non ostentatione popularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in fronte ostentatio sit, intus veritas occultetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <trans><tr>feigned pain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(captivi) producti ostentationis causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 71 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui latius ostentationis causā vagarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostentator: <entryFree id="n33158" type="main" key="ostenta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostentātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ostento</etym>, <sense id="n33158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">self-satisfied exhibiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a displayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaunter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentatores meri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentatorem pecuniae gloriosum describere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 50, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium, quae diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rector juveni et ceteris periculorum praemiorumque ostentator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostentatorius: <entryFree id="n33159" type="main" key="ostenta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostentātōrĭus</orth>, v. ostentarius.</entryFree>
ostentatrix: <entryFree id="n33160" type="main" key="ostenta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostentātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ostentator</etym>, <sense id="n33160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that displays</hi> or <hi rend="ital">boasts</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n33160.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">immodica sui ostentatrix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 323, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33160.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pompa ostentatrix vani splendoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 439</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostentifer: <entryFree id="n33161" type="gloss" key="ostenti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostentĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ostentumfero</etym>, <sense id="n33161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">portentous</hi>: ostentiferum, <foreign lang="greek">teratw=des</foreign>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
ostento: <entryFree id="n33162" type="main" key="ostento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (<sense id="n33162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> ostentarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 129</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>ostendo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to present to view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n33162.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui jugula sua pro capite alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to present</tr>, <tr>offer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campos nitentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sidonias opes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passum capillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 34</bibl></cit>: quo res sapsa loco sese ostentat, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=325" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 325</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 372 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n33162.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n33162.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To show off</hi> with vanity or boastfulness, <hi rend="ital">to display</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a display of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boast of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaunt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem tibi meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid me ostentem,</quote> <trans><tr>why should I make a display of myself?</tr></trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et prae se ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriae ostentandae causā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 30, 47</bibl></cit>: clientelas, Dolabell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphos suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum ipsum aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 49, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in aliis rebus,</quote> <trans><tr>to exhibit themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:28:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 28, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ambiorigem ostentant fidei faciundae causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33162.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hold out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">up</hi> as an example: <cit><quote lang="la">desine Tydiden vultuque et murmure nobis Ostentare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 350</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33162.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hold out</hi> for the purpose of offering or giving; <hi rend="ital">to proffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterā manu fert lapidem, panem ostentat alterā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 28, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:89:1" default="NO" valid="yes">89, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia modo, modo formidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 68:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 68, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33162.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hold out</hi> in a threatening manner; <hi rend="ital">to threaten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">menace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedem, servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33162.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To show</hi> by speech or signs; <hi rend="ital">to indicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">point out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reveal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disclose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(largitio) verbis ostentari potest, re verā fieri, nisi exhausto aerario, nullo pacto potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi me istis esse familiarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principem,</quote> <trans><tr>to reveal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:4:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: ostentans, quanta eos... invidia maneret <hi rend="ital">showing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declaring</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ostentum: <entryFree id="n33163" type="main" key="ostentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. ostendo <sense id="n33163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ostentus: <entryFree id="n33164" type="main" key="ostentus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from ostendo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33165" type="main" key="ostentus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostentus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ostendo</etym>. <sense id="n33165.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a showing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibiting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpora extra vallum abjecta ostentui,</quote> <trans><tr>as a public spectacle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrocitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:48" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33165.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n33165.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">external appearance</hi>:<pb n="1284" /> <cb n="OSTI" />  nova jura Cappadociae dedit bstentui magis, quam mansura, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 78</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33165.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proof</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Jugurthae scelerum ostentui essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 24, 9</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">a pretence</hi>, a sign given to deceive, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 46, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ostentui esset, multum vitalis spiritūs egestum,</quote> <trans><tr>as a proof that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentui clementiae suae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentui habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 6, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostes: <entryFree id="n33166" type="greek" key="ostes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)/sths</foreign>, <sense id="n33166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of earthquake</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 65, 30.</sense></entryFree>
ostia: <entryFree id="n33167" type="main" key="Osti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ostĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ostĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ostium; cf. Engl. mouth, in Ply-mouth, Yar-mouth, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n33167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seaport town in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the mouth of the Tiber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built by Ancus Marcius</hi>, still called <hi rend="ital">Ostia</hi>: Ostiam urbem ad exitum Tiberis in mare fluentis Ancus Marcius rex condidisse fertur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=197" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 197</bibl> Müll.; cf.: urbs, quam secundum ostium Tiberis (Ancus Marcius) posuit, ex quo etiam Ostiam. id. s. v. Quiritium, p. 254 ib.; <cit><quote lang="la">Enn. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. quaeso, p. 258 ib. (Ann. v. 145 Vahl.): in ore Tiberis Ostia urbs condita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 3, 5</bibl>.—Form Ostia, ōrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 37, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33167.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ostĭen-sis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ostia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ostian</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Ostiensis ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 23, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestor (L. Saturninus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <trans><tr>the duty of one of the quœstors to superintend the aqueducts leading to Rome</tr>, <tr>and the supplying of Rome with corn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incommodum,</quote> <trans><tr>the capture of the Roman fleet by pirates at Ostia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostiarium: <entryFree id="n33168" type="main" key="osti^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. 2. ostiarius, II.</entryFree>
ostiarius: <entryFree id="n33169" type="main" key="osti^a_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. 2. ostiarius, I.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33170" type="main" key="osti^a_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ostium</etym>, <sense id="n33170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the door</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancilla,</quote> <trans><tr>portress</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 18, 17</bibl></cit>; usu. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33170.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ostĭā-rĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a door-keeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porter</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">janitor, portitor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 9, 22</bibl>.—By the rich they were, in early times, occasionally chained up, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 3</bibl>.—In the Christian church, <hi rend="ital">a sexton</hi>, Cod. Th. 1, 3, 6; 16, 2, 27.—</sense><sense id="n33170.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ostĭāria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female doorkeeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portress</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 10, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Johan. 18, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33170.3" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ostĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a tax upon doors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a door-tax</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnaria, ostiaria, frumentum, vecturae imperabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32</bibl></cit> (called exactio ostiorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 5</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
ostiatim: <entryFree id="n33171" type="main" key="osti^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostĭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n33171.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">from door to door</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from house to house</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ostiatim oppidum compilare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere crimen,</quote> <trans><tr>to enumerate the several houses where a crime was perpetrated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">48: nec scrutanda singula et velut ostiatim pulsanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:112" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33171.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">by particulars</hi> or <hi rend="ital">details</hi> (post-class.): quicumque ostiatim cupit noscere (<hi rend="ital">wishes to know the particulars</hi>), legat, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ostiensis: <entryFree id="n33172" type="main" key="Osti^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ostĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Ostia, II.</entryFree>
ostigo: <entryFree id="n33173" type="main" key="osti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, in the lang. of shepherds, <sense id="n33173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of eruption</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scab on lambs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> mentigo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 21</bibl>; v. mentigo.</sense></entryFree>
ostiolum: <entryFree id="n33174" type="main" key="osti^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ostium</etym>, <sense id="n33174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little door</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostiola olitoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 38, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abscondita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 14, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostium: <entryFree id="n33175" type="main" key="osti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindred with Sanscr. oshtha, labium; Slav. ūsta, the same; cf. os</etym>, <sense id="n33175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a door</hi> (class.; cf.: porta, janua, fores, valvae). </sense><sense id="n33175.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia istaec auscultavi ab ostio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">observare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 81</bibl></cit>: rectum ostium, <hi rend="ital">the front-door</hi> (cf. posticum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 58</bibl> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aperire,</quote> <trans><tr>to open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operire,</quote> <trans><tr>to shut</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obserare intus,</quote> <trans><tr>to bolt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obdere pessulum ostio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concrepuit ostium a Glycerio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: inscribat aliquis arse verse in ostio, Afran. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 18</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium limenque carceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperto ostio dormire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere ab ostio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:68:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 68, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exactio ostiorum,</quote> <trans><tr>doortax</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. 2. ostiarius, III.: sepulcri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:23:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 23, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33175.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an entrance</hi> of any kind: <cit><quote lang="la">Acheruntis ostium in nostrost agro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2</bibl></cit>, <cb n="OSTR" /> 4, 124: aperto ex ostio Alti Acheruntis. Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra Inferni ostia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 467</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in rimis areae grana oblitescant, et ostia aperiant muribus ac formicis,</quote> <trans><tr>entrances</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:51:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 51, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis,</quote> <trans><tr>mouth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 45</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberinaque ad ostia venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 728</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceani,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Strait of Gibraltar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:9:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 9, 3</bibl>.—Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sum ostium ovium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 10, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostocopos: <entryFree id="n33176" type="greek" key="osto^co^po^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostŏcŏpŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)stoko/pos</foreign>, <sense id="n33176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">boneracking</hi>, a disease (as if the bones were giving way; <cit><quote lang="la">post-class.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 48, 892</bibl></cit>; Pelag. Vet. 3; 10.</sense></entryFree>
ostorius: <entryFree id="n33177" type="main" key="Osto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ostōrĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several Romans.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33177.1" n="I" level="1"> Ostorins Sabinus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman knight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33177.2" n="II" level="1"> P. Ostorius Scapula, <hi rend="ital">proprœtor in Britain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello egregius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33177.3" n="III" level="1"> M. Ostorius Scapula, <hi rend="ital">son of Publius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 31</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">put to death by Nero</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16</bibl>. 15.</sense></entryFree>
ostracias: <entryFree id="n33178" type="greek" key="ostra^ci^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrăcĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrăcītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ostraki/as, o)straki=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n33178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a semigem</hi>, prob. <hi rend="ital">hornstone</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chalcedony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 65, § 177</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ostracites: <entryFree id="n33179" type="greek" key="ostra^ci_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrăcītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)straki/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n33179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 31, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ostracitis: <entryFree id="n33180" type="greek" key="ostra^ci_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrăcītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)straki=tis</foreign>. <sense id="n33180.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hornstone;</hi> v. ostracias.—</sense><sense id="n33180.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of cadmia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 10, 22, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ostracium: <entryFree id="n33181" type="greek" key="ostra^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrăcĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrăcĕum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)stra/kion</foreign>, <sense id="n33181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mussel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> onyx, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 46, § 134</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ostrea: <entryFree id="n33182" type="greek" key="ostre^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and (rarely) <orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/streon</foreign>, <sense id="n33182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an oyster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mussel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea-snail</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n33182.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form ostrea, <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Heduph. 2</bibl> (p. 166 Vahl.); Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 216, 6</bibl>; Afran.; Turp. and Varr. ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 8</bibl>; Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 216, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrearum vivaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 54, 79, § 168</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33182.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form ostreum: luna alit ostrea, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:8:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 8, 4</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 216, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrea Circeis, Miseno oriuntur echini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:174" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:142" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 142</bibl>. —In <number>sing.</number> collect.: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrei testas siccas tundere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 41, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostrearius: <entryFree id="n33183" type="main" key="ostre^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ostrea</etym>, <sense id="n33183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to oysters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oyster-</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <trans><tr>oyster-bread</tr>, <tr>bread eaten with oysters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 27, § 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33183.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrĕā-rĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an oyster-bed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 74, § 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Baiano locare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostreatus: <entryFree id="n33184" type="main" key="ostre^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.; qs. covered with oyster-shells; hence, transf.</etym>, <sense id="n33184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scabby</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi ostreatum tergum ulceribus (i. e. verberibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 186</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostreosus: <entryFree id="n33185" type="main" key="ostre^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrĕōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in oysters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyzicus ostreosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 77</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 18, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ostreum: <entryFree id="n33186" type="main" key="ostre^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. ostrea.</entryFree>
ostriago: <entryFree id="n33187" type="main" key="ostri^a_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrĭāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ostricolor: <entryFree id="n33188" type="main" key="ostri^co^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrĭcŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ostrum-color</etym>, <sense id="n33188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purple-colored</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ostrifer: <entryFree id="n33189" type="main" key="ostri^fe^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrĭfĕr</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ostrum-fero</etym>, <sense id="n33189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abounding in oysters</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Abydos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Geraestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:456" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 456</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chalcedon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:959" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 959</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostrinus: <entryFree id="n33190" type="main" key="ostri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ostrum</etym>, <sense id="n33190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purple</hi> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): supparum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 549, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ricula, Turp. ib.: colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:12:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 14, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:27:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 27, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ostrogothus: <entryFree id="n33191" type="main" key="Ostro^go^thus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ostrŏgŏthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ostrŏgŏtha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Ostrogoth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ostrogothum continere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 377</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium Ostrogothae vastarent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Jornand.</author> Reb. Get. 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 153</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ostrum: <entryFree id="n33192" type="greek" key="ostrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/streon</foreign>. <sense id="n33192.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the blood of the sea-snail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purple</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">murex, purpura): ostro Perfusae vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33192.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33192.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Stuff dyed with purple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a purple dress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purple covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">textilibus si in picturis ostroque rubenti Jacteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stratoque super discumbitur ostro,</quote> <trans><tr>on purple-covered couches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 700</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sarrano dormire ostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velare umeros ostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:814" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 814</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 3, 51: <cit><quote lang="la">cenae sine aulaeis et ostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33192.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The brilliancy of purple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purple</hi>, Auct. Aetnae, 332. <cb n="OTIO" /></sense></entryFree>
ostrya: <entryFree id="n33193" type="greek" key="ostry^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrya</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ostrys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)stru/a, o)/strus</foreign>, <sense id="n33193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tree with hard wood</hi>, perh. the common <hi rend="ital">hornbeam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 21, 37, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
osus: <entryFree id="n33194" type="main" key="o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōsus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōsūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n33194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Partt.</hi>, v. odi.</sense></entryFree>
osyris: <entryFree id="n33195" type="greek" key="o^sy^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏsyris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/suris</foreign>, <sense id="n33195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, prob. <hi rend="ital">the broom-like goose-foot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">summer cypress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 88, § 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
otacilius: <entryFree id="n33196" type="main" key="O^ta_ci^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏtācĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏtācĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So, </sense><sense id="n33196.1" n="1" level="3"> Otacilius Crassus, <hi rend="ital">an adherent of Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 28 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n33196.2" n="2" level="3"> T. Otacilius, <hi rend="ital">a proprœtor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 56</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">OTACILIA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 29, 2</bibl></cit>; Eckh. D. N. 7, p. 332.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33196.3" n="II" level="1"> OTACILIANA VILLA, <hi rend="ital">of an Otacilius</hi>, Inscr. Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 577.</sense></entryFree>
otacustes: <entryFree id="n33197" type="greek" key="o_ta^custes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōtăcustes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)takousth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a listener</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eavesdropper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spy</hi> (post-class.): otacustarum relatio, App. de Mundo, p. 69, 31.</sense></entryFree>
otho: <entryFree id="n33198" type="main" key="O^tho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏtho</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/oqwn</foreign>, <sense id="n33198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33198.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Roscius Otho, <hi rend="ital">a knight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and author of the law that the knights should occupy the first fourteen seats in the theatre next to the orchestra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:19:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 19, 40</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cornel. p. 79" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cornel. p. 79</bibl> Orell.—Hence, sic libitum vano, qui nos distinxit, Othoni, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:159" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 159</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33198.2" n="II" level="1"> M. Salvius Otho, <hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose biography is given by Suetonius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis Otho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:32:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 32, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:99" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 99</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33198.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏthōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the emperor Otho</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Othonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Othoniani duces,</quote> <trans><tr>of the emperor Otho</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
othonna: <entryFree id="n33199" type="greek" key="o^thonna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏthonna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/qonna</foreign>, <sense id="n33199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Syrian plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 85, § 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
othrepte: <entryFree id="n33200" type="main" key="Othrepte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Othreptē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n33200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Amazons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 963" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 963</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
othryades: <entryFree id="n33201" type="main" key="Othry^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Othryădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)oqrua/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n33201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a male proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33201.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The son of Othrys</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Panthus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Panthus Othryades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 319</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33201.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Spartan general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a battle against the Argives</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was the sole survivor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:665" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 665</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi></sense></entryFree>
othrys: <entryFree id="n33202" type="main" key="Othrys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Othrys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/oqrus</foreign>, <sense id="n33202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Thessaly</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ierako</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homolen Othrymque nivalem Linquentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 675</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1168" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1168</bibl></cit>.—Acc. to the later poets, situated in Thrace, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:655" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 655</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:24" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 24</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Othrysĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Othrysian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Othrysias pruinas (al. Odrysias),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis (al. Odrysius),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Thrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
otia: <entryFree id="n33203" type="greek" key="o_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)ti/on</foreign> (little ear), <sense id="n33203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of mussel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
otiabundus: <entryFree id="n33204" type="main" key="o_ti^a_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōtĭābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>otior</etym>, <sense id="n33204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enjoying leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keeping holiday</hi> (postclass.). <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
otiolum: <entryFree id="n33205" type="hapax" key="o_ti^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōtĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>otium</etym>, <sense id="n33205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little leisure</hi>: otiolum meum, <hi rend="ital">my little bit of leisure</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
otior: <entryFree id="n33206" type="main" key="o_ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōtĭor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to have</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enjoy leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be at leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep holiday</hi> (rare but class.): cum se Syracusas otiandi, non negotiandi causā contulisset, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domesticus otior,</quote> <trans><tr>I idle about at home</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
otiose: <entryFree id="n33207" type="main" key="o_ti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōtĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. otiosus <sense id="n33207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
otiositas: <entryFree id="n33208" type="main" key="o_ti^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōtĭōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>otiosus</etym>, <sense id="n33208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idleness</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n33208.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">multam mahtiam docuit otiositas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 33, 29</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33208.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a writing composed at leisure moments</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">suas otiositates edere,</quote> <trans><tr>the fruils of leisure</tr>, <tr>poems</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
otiosus: <entryFree id="n33209" type="main" key="o_ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōtĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>otium</etym>, <sense id="n33209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unoccupied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disengaged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unemployed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idle</hi> (class.; cf. feriatus, immunis; opp. negotiosus). </sense><sense id="n33209.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n33209.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis otiosum te arbitror hominem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis etiam maneo otiosus hic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum essem otiosus domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus humanis aliquos otiosos deos praeficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:39:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 39, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33209.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n33209.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Without official employment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free from public affairs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo in studio hominum quoque ingeniosissimorum otiosissimorumque totas aetates videmus esse contritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem locum nos otiosi convertimus,</quote> <trans><tr>in an interval of leisure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:30:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 30, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeculum se atque otiosum putari maluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:51:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 51, 110</bibl></cit>: numquam se minus otiosum esse, quam cum otiosus, <hi rend="ital">that he was never less at leisure than when</hi> <pb n="1285" /> <cb n="OTIU" /> <hi rend="ital">free from official business</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum a te tua promissa flagitabam, ad urbem te otiosissimum esse arbitrabar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum otiosus stilum prehenderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:24:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 24, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33209.5" n="2" level="3"> With respect to participation, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconcerned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indifferent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neutral</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatores otiosi Leuctricae calamitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam enim non modo armatis, sed etiam otiosis minabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33209.6" n="3" level="3"> Without excitement, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passionless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam istos, quibus odio est otium, quietissimos atque otiosissimos reddam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:37:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 37, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide ut otiosus it,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 25, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33209.7" n="4" level="3"> Of style, <hi rend="ital">tedious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cicero) lentus est in principiis, longus in narrationibus, otiosus circa excessus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33209.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">That has leisure</hi> for any thing; with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: studiorum otiosi, Plin. H. N. praef. § 6.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n33209.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōtĭōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a private person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one not in official life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et facilior et tutior vita est otiosorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 21, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otioso vero et nihil agenti privato, ... quando imperium senatus dedit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 20</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33209.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Non-combatants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">civilians</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudeliter enim otiosis minabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 6, 3</bibl></cit> (B. and K. otiosissimi): <cit><quote lang="la">militare nomen grave inter otiosos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33209.11" n="II" level="1"> Of inanim. and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">at leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unemployed</hi>: otioso in otio animus nescit, quid velit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 12</bibl> (Trag. v. 256 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ego, cui fuerit ne otium quidem umquam otiosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 27, 66</bibl></cit>: pecuniae, <hi rend="ital">idle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unemployed</hi> (opp. occupatus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:62:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 62, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his supplicationum otiosis diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid quiete otiosius animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:13:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33209.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33209.13" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Idle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unprofitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superfluous</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignavus, iners, desidiosus): sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otiosissimae occupationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">otiosum est persequi singula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 4, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 23, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33209.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi> from any thing; with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo nunc jam otioso esse impero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est animi quiete otiosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33209.15" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">With a quiet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gentle motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons vel rivus huc conveniat otiosus,</quote> <trans><tr>flowing quietly</tr>, <tr>gently</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 37, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōtĭōsē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n33209.16" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">at leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at ease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without occupation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:26:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 26, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inambulare in foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnast res, quam ego tecum otiose, si otiumst, cupio loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33209.17" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33209.18" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Calmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quietly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without haste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gradually</hi>: ambula ergo cito. <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Immo otiose, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 66</bibl> (opp. to properare): <cit><quote lang="la">bene et otiose percoquere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemplari unumquodque otiose et considerare coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:15:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 15, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:13:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 13, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segniter, otiose, neglegenter, contumaciter omnia agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33209.19" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Free from fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quietly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fearlessly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ademptum tibi jam faxo omnem metum, in aurem utramvis otiose ut dormias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
otis: <entryFree id="n33210" type="greek" key="o_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)ti/s</foreign>, <sense id="n33210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of bustard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 22, 29, § 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:131" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 14, 45, § 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
otium: <entryFree id="n33211" type="main" key="o_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōtĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n33211.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vacant time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freedom from business</hi> (class.; opp. negotium; cf.: immunitas, vacatio): otio qui nescit uti plus negoti habet, Quam, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 12</bibl> (Trag. v. 252 Vahl.): fecero; <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam haut otium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantumne ab re tuast oti tibi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: clarorum virorum atque magnorum non minus otii quam negotii rationem exstare oportere, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 27, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in otio de negotiis cogitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium inertissimum et desidiosissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33211.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n33211.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Ease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactivity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idle life</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignavia, desidia, inertia): vitam in otio agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hebescere et languescere in otio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter desidiam in otio vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 37, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otio tabescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">languere otio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium segne trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna otia caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:394" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium sine litteris mors est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere otia segnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere otia molli cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:707" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 707</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n33211.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">time</hi> for any thing; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. for literary occupation: otium moderatum atque honestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: ad scribendum,<cb n="OVIL" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium consumere in historiā scribendā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium litteratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tusculani requies atque otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:52:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 52, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 22, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abundare otio et studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium rei si sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium habere ad potandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auscultandi,</quote> <trans><tr>time to hear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum libros delectationi causa, cum est otium, legere soleo,</quote> <trans><tr>when I have time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si modo tibi est otium,</quote> <trans><tr>if you have time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium studio suppeditare,</quote> <trans><tr>to devote time to study</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in otium venerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me alebat Parthenope studiis florentem ignobilis oti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unwarlike</tr>, <tr>peaceful leisure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 564</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33211.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The fruit of leisure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">otia nostra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>my poems</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:224" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 224</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33211.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peace</hi> (opp. bellum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax, tranquillitas, otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:37:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 37, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollia peragebant otia,</quote> <trans><tr>enjoyed calm repose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo insolens belli diuturnitate otii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ad otium deducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde me ad otium pacemque converto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex maximo bello tantum otium toti insulae conciliavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia per otium concelebrata,</quote> <trans><tr>in times of peace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hoste otium fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab seditionibus urbanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium bello (rogare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 15, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quies aëris et otium et tranquillitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:2:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33211.6" n="D" level="2"> Adverb. </sense><sense id="n33211.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> otio, <hi rend="ital">at leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leisurely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam libet lambe otio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 24, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33211.8" n="2" level="3"> Per otium, <hi rend="ital">at leisure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
